Reviews.Title: “Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: Lesya L
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location - 10 min walk from the centre. Tiny room at the basement floor we were unlucky to get leaved me extremely unhappy. FREE INTERNET but only in the lobby! And I would have never rate this hotel as a 3*

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, would not stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mathelaci
Reviews.Content: Tiny room, stained carpets! Clean bathroom. Approximately 15 minutes away from Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: hotel is nice, staff helpful, internet free but slow, the room i had was tiny, my colleague had a bigger one for the same price. very nice location: 10min footwalk to city center

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Breakfast provided, Even though not central close to many amenities and attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Doodyjazz
Reviews.Content: Had a good two nights stay here. Very clean rooms, small, but with a private toilet and shower. Had a nice view of the park next door, quiet part of town. They do serve a nice breakfast down in the basement, had all I could eat and then some. Good service, they had messed up our reservations, but fixed everything right away with no waiting and were very apologetic. Seems this location might be out of the way, but trams and busses run here every few minutes, so easy to get anywhere from here. Lots of restaurants near-by, several cafes, one of the best coffeeshops (Het Ballonettje), the Artis (zoo), Resistance Museum, Werthiem Park, Hortus Botanicus, Rembrandthuis Museum (where Rembrandt lived), and the University of Amsterdam all within walking distance. A little pricey perhaps, especially if you don't spend much time in the room, but ask for special deals, they can usually help you out. Usually a late check-in, after 12pm, but they will hold your bags in a secured room if you want to wander around while you wait. Go to Cafe Koosje just down the street, great place for coffee, drinks, and food.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: Ceara26
Reviews.Content: Me and boyfriend went to Amsterdam at the beginning of February. I had read not that great reviews so was a bit nervous but it was fine! We got there really just after 12 but they allowed us to check in! we had a room on the lowest floor, it was small but cosy and clean. It snowed A LOT while we were there and coming home after our first day the room was freezing! The radiator wasnt that hot so we asked if we could change rooms and it wasnt a problem at all, they were really friendly. We got moved to another floor and the room tripled in size, was huge! Still nice and clean also and lovely and warm in the -9 degrees outside! We walked everywhere and wasnt that bad even in the snow but there are trams about a minute walk if you want to get places quicker. Overall a great lil hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great place if you want to visit Artis”
Reviews.Author: GreenBeansSuisse
Reviews.Content: A nice, frinedly, not very large hotel The front door is opposite the entrance of Artis zoo conference rooms! I was in Amsterdam for an evening reception in Artis, so it was perfect for me. Not so good if you want to be in the real centre of Amsterdam, but tram and metro will get you there in minutes. Nice room with tea and coffee facilities. Internet available, but you must pay. Shower, no bath. Very extensive breakfast in the basement. The lift is slow, but it works. Check in was easy, and i was allowed to get my key early in the morning, which is very unusual these days. Checking out was slow, but that was due to the computer, not the service. Nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “its ok...”
Reviews.Author: happiness1973
Reviews.Content: the hotel is average. I have stayed in many hotels and this one is a little noisy (from other guests) the breakfast is average and is served in a basement room. The rooms are not fully cleaned each day. The carpet is dirty and obviously has not been changed for years - lots of stains and felt dirty. The hotel looks much better in the photos and is not plush in any way. If you are looking for somewhere cheap to stay in a good location then it is not a bad choice. Ask for a room on 1st of second floor, i can't imagine how dismal it would be being on the ground or basement rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: irish_lad84
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 day break in this hotel. Firstly to get to the hotel from Central Station, get the number 9 tram and it drops you off less than 2 minute walk from hotel at a cost of â‚¬2.70. We arrived to hotel at 1 oclock and were asked to wait 20 minutes to allow room be prepared, we didnt mind as in hotel reception was computer free internet access. Rooms are small and bathroom very small however the most important thing was how clean they were -- so many hotels in Amsterdam get poor reviews for cleaniness however this was not an issue here!!! It takes about 20minutes to walk to Dam Square. Across the street is the zoo and if you walk 5 minutes to the left there are plenty of resturants, shops etc. All in all hotel is a very good base. We didnt eat in hotel so we cant comment on food/prices. Hotel staff were helpful and pleasent. I would return!!

Reviews.Title: “not the basement”
Reviews.Author: soldad
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel,cheap 5 mins to town center by tram.do not book a basement room as the damp ,traffic and partygoers will keep you up all nigght

Reviews.Title: “Lacaster hotel review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, but poor room sizes. The online photos of the rooms had no reflection of the room we were given. Far older and smaller than we expected. Some nice coffee shops in the area plus very close to the zoo. Very expensive breakfast considering the price of the room. We were able to check in earlier than 2 oclock which was nice and the check out time of 12 o'clock also suited our travel needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good price”
Reviews.Author: OmiDhaka
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in quite area of Amsterdam but jut a short walk to all tourist sight. If you do not want to walk, trum stop is 2 min walk. Check in was perfect with minimum time. My room was on 1st floor. Room is indeed a bit small but I stayed several hotel in Amsterdam and believe me the room size of some other hotel even more smaller. Nice and clean bed, perfect for sleeping. Toilet is small but well organized. Good breakfast menu, if you consider the price. Internet is free in the lounge. Only one thing I did not liked that if somebody talking loudly in next room you will be able to hear from your room. Good for anykind of traveller. For family the zoo is just opposite of the hotel. Staffs are very friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic location! Canâ€™t wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: StinaBena
Reviews.Content: BOOKING: We booked a double room for me and my partner via Expedia. The hotel seemed very good value and the reviews for this hotel were mainly good. LOCATION: The location was perfect. We walked to the hotel from the train station when we arrived, this was an easy walk but probably best to get a tram if you have trouble walking or children. There is a tram stop just outside the hotel so that would also be an easy convenient way of getting to the hotel. I chose the hotel as it looked like it was within walking distance of most places and it was. It was just about 20minutes to the very centre of town, with plenty of sights, cafes, bars and things to do in that distance. You walk past the Portuguese Synagogue, Jewish Historical Museum and Rembrandts House before you get to Waag Square. The hotel is on a lovely quite road and opposite the Artis Zoo area. There are cafes and bakeries on this road as well as a tattoo museum. Iâ€™m not a very active person but found I could do lots of walking and the route into the centre of Amsterdam was not a trek! SERVICE & HOTEL: The staff were very polite, welcoming and well mannered, also very well dressed. Checking in was easy and straight forward. We were also given a hotel gift bag containing pens, sweets, lip balm, toothbrushes and the hotelâ€™s own quick guide too Amsterdam. We were not expecting that and it was a nice touch. We had a swipe card as our key which worked every time without any problems. The hotel was smart, modern and elegant as well as warm cosy and welcoming on the cold January night that we checked in. We did not have breakfast but Iâ€™d imagine it was going to be good. There were vending machines with hot drinks, crisps and beer for anyone coming in late and needing some refreshments. This was handy. The beds were made and towels changed daily and the cleaning/maid staff were very friendly and polite. We were also allowed to leave our luggage at the hotel in the luggage room all day. This service was free of charge where many hotels would charge you. Check out time was also 12pm Middayâ€¦which was wonderful!!! PLEASE NOTE: We had to pay a City Tax upon leaving the hotel but that is the same in ALL Amsterdam hotels so we were expecting to pay it. Be aware of this as it is not the hotel being bad it is a normal tax that must be paid. I have seen some bad reviews about this but I think they are by people who have not done their research, or checked their booking information properly. ROOM: We were in a room on the 3rd floor, there was a convenient lift for us to use. The room was very modern, sleek and city style. They had artwork/dÃ©cor to compliment the city and the headboard was engraved with the shapes of the Amsterdam city skyline. The room was small but with plenty of space to get around the bed and for our suitcases. The one wall was taken up with windows giving us a lovely view of the houses and gardens behind the hotel. The wardrobe was spacious and had an electronic safe that worked really well. There were tea/coffee making facilities and a flat screen tv that had a personalised welcome greeting on it when we came into the room. The room was bright, airy, clean smelling and modern. Everything we needed was there and everything was in full working order. BED: It was a double done continental style with 2 mattresses together and separate duvets. There were lots of pillows to make the bed nice and to use as many as you required. The sheets were very clean, warm and soft. The bed was incredibly comfortable and I looked forward to sleeping in it every night. BATHROOM: The washroom was small but perfect. It was laid out like a continental wet room, where the shower is pretty much in the room. This is normal for the continent. There was also space under the sink for bathroom things. There was also complimentary soap, shower caps and shower gel. The shower was nice and hot and powerful. There was an electric shaving point and a hairdryer too. OVERALL: Lots of the reviews were poor because the rooms were small, I think that this is completely unfounded as the size does not make the room. Some reviews suggested that it would not be suitable for a couple to stay. This is also wrong as we had a lovely stay! Iâ€™d say this hotel is perfect for families (â€¦as the zoo is across the road), and for couples as it is nice and quiet but close to everywhere you need to go. The hotel also looks very suitable for people on business as the rooms were well equipped with internet points, power, stationary and the hotel has a conference room. I thought maybe when we got there we would need to catch a tram into town but actually we were so close to the centre that we really couldnâ€™t justify a tram. We walked to Vondel Park, Jordaan, the Red Light District, Oosterpark, Leidsplein with no problemsâ€¦even though the weather was bad we still managed to do lots of exploring! I will definately stay at Eden Lancaster on my next trip to Amsterdam. I canâ€™t wait to come back it was just lovely. Thank you to all the lovely staff!

Reviews.Title: “A bit like faulty towers”
Reviews.Author: epj123
Reviews.Content: Pleasant on face value, until you are confronted by a buffoon male receptionist with the hospitality capabilities of KGB operative. A few issues over pre payment of the rooms via laterooms.com, an issue that could have been resolved easily if it were not for him being abrupt and diverting from our conversation to answer the telephone - pretty lousy customer service. One of our rooms was fine, well equipped and spacious. The other room was half the size - a pretty severe inconsistency when both parties are paying the same price. Outside our rooms on the radiator, we found a key card, perhaps left by a member of staff - One of my colleagues thinking it was for her room unlocked her door, however then found her own key in her pocket. On further probing we discovered that this key could unlock both doors. Leaving a master key lying around outside peoples rooms is a pretty big security issue. Not massively impressed. My other colleague popped down to find a manager, and was informed by said KGB operative that he was the manager, a statement that he quickly retracted on further questioning. Pretending to be a manager to a guest?! Mad! Apart from these little incidents we had a very pleasant night out in the city - marred only by being woken up at 11.00am by a housekeeper asking if the room was vacant. Clearly not. Have you no system of checking?? (We were informed by the KGB operative/Receptionist/masquerading Manager that check out was mid day.) On an upwards note they did store our bags for us during the day. Bit iffy to be honest

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MioButton
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were lovely, our room was cleaned and we were only staying for two nights! (we had clean towels without requesting them.) The room itself was a good size, very clean, had plenty of space and was styled nicely. The beds were so comfortable and it was nice and warm in the room morning and night. The bathroom was spotless too with a good hair-dryer and a shower that stayed nice and warm. We were only a fifteen minute walk from the city centre and Dam Square, we only had to use the tram (that stops outside every ten minutes) on our last day instead of carrying our cases to centraal station, otherwise everything is in walking distance and it's such a picturesque and exciting place to walk around! I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliRaz59
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, and I enjoyed it so much. It was clean, not crowded, and faily located, a 10 minute walk to many sight seeings and the dam-square. The hotel is worth the rate. It is also in front of the very beautiful Aris zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, some staff not very good”
Reviews.Author: norm6001
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, but small for a twin double, the bathroom was tiny but with all facilities provided. I think for New Year you would expect a hotel to have a selection of drinks available, no, only white wine and tinned lager (Grolsh) also I left my travel mug in our room on checkout and when I asked for its return later that day it had magically disappeared. The key card failed 3 times in a 2 day stay The beds were comfortable and tv was in various languages. Location wise its ideal, tram stops virtually outside the hotel and public transport is its usual excellent. I would stay again, but watch out for the City Tax thats tagged onto your bill when checking out, they don't tell you about this when you arrive and also they want credit/debit card details on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short break!”
Reviews.Author: Emily G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights with my partner and wasn't expecting much after reading other reveiws on the site. However, we were pleasently suprised! We found the hotel to be clean and comfortable, fine for a city break. We didn't spend very long in the hotel as there is so much to see in the city but it was a decent place to rest my head at the end of a long day! The rooms are quite small but beds were clean and comfortable, the linen wasn't changed during our stay but I wasn't expecting this for a 3 star hotel, we were only there for 2 nights after all! The decor is themed to the city which we liked instead of a generic hotel. There are amsterdam pictures on the wall etc. There was a TV in the room although some channels could not get a signal, as we only had the TV on for a few minutes after getting into bed, this didn't bother us (what's the point of going on holiday to watch TV?!?!), there are enough English channels to make do! The bathroom again was small but functional, there was fresh sealed soap, shower caps and plenty of clean towels. The only criticism I have of the bathroom is that the loo did have some limescale staining. There was a selection of tea and coffee in the room but only enough for one tea and one coffee. This was replaced each day but a bigger selection would have been nice (I expect we could have got more if we'd asked at reception). The breakfast isn't great but edible, there is plenty of variety, continental and an attempt at full English (shredded bacon, boiled or scrambled eggs) but no fried eggs, beans or tomatoes. A little disappointing on the whole. We found the location of the hotel to be fine,it was nice to be a little way out of the city so it wasn't noisy. The zoo is on the same street although we did not visit it. The number 9 tramstop is literally just outside the door of the hotel. We used the tram to and from the train station but chose to walk the rest of the time to allow us to see more of the city. It is about 15 minutes into the centre of the city but after approx 5-10 minutes you arrive at shops, coffeeshops etc. From the airport, it's around 40 euro for a taxi but we chose the authentic route of train and tram, the trams are great and staff are very helpful. The train station was a little confusing as it was so busy but again, the staff are helpful. The machines at the station were not accepting cash at the time so we had to use the kiosk but this gave me chance to make sure we had the right tickets etc. Overall a very enjoyable break. I'm sure there are better hotels than this but you pay for what you get, for a short city break this hotel is a decent choice and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Will Do, If Visiting Amsterdam for a Bender!”
Reviews.Author: RYAN S
Reviews.Content: Not the best Hotel by far, but not bad. rooms were ok but nothing special. general clenliness was about 6/10 which is not the best but for the price you cant complain, the hotel is what it is really just a basic hotel a fair trek from the city center about 15-20mins walk. the service was fairly good but i wouldnt stay there again due to its location and id prefer a slightly cleaner modern room. However there is a Quality Coffee shop around the corner called Het Ballonje great products!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Eden hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hurby S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in all Eden hotels in Amsterdam, but this was worst. Rooms in the cellar of the hotel next to the entrance, with all guests outside smoking. Bad bed, dirty floor and bathroom. Bathroom must be refurnished. Private mobile internet is not working in cellar, so you must buy the internet if you want to work at this mini desk. TV channels not able to be viewed due to snowy screen.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: dawn6728
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights on 27 and 28 November as part of a P & O package. Yes, the room was small and the bathroom tiny, but they were both very clean. The bed was very comfortable and a good quality pillow (important)! Initially the room was cold but soon warmed up. The room had all the facilities, hairdryer, kettle, TV. We didn't pay a lot for our trip to Amsterdam and so really we shouldn't expect too much, but this hotel surpassed our expectations. Also, the location was superb, a 20 minute walk to the centre of Amsterdam. You really do get what you pay for - so we were pleasantly surprised. Well done Eden Lancaster.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay..........”
Reviews.Author: janine801
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at start of week for 3 days and 2 nights, we had a fantastic stay here. Bedroom was comfy and cosy, bathroom was small but had everything we needed. We didnt stay very much in hotel as there is soo much to do in Amsterdam its a place to rest ur head....... Great vending machines available for tea, coffee cold drinks and snacks, internet available and use of hotel computer was great...... Cleaner was very good she came and asked when we would be going out and came back when we left and room was spottless when we came back. Hotel is close to everywhere, tram stop right outside and you can buy tram tickets at reception too... Never had breakfast here but we did a few doors down in a lovely wee cafe that done breakfast for 5 euro each!!!!!!!!! We went to local supermarket and bought alcohol and brought back to hotel that had ice available for guests..... Staff were very helpfull with all our needs and very friendly.........

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location within walking distance of city life”
Reviews.Author: keh75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is across from Artis Zoo and on an easy tram route( number9) to city. Bought this room with P/O package. Good value for the price we paid. The room was small but well fitted with Comfortable beds. Bathroom tiny but again well fitted. Can't comment on restaurant because we were out most of the trip. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area, but a bit bummed out by basement room”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian_Couple25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in nice condition, situated in a quiet and nice area of Amsterdam, easily accessible by tram and bus. The room was nice, a bit cheapily interior, and the safe is easily carried out if one wanted to. However a lot of the rooms are in the basement, and the view out the window are of people's feet, and therfore you can't open it, just a vent, letting some air in. I would probably not stay here again if I got the basement room again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic hotel in good location-good value”
Reviews.Author: ryrobot
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews I wasn't to sure what to expect, I guess it depends on how fussy you are! The hotel was clean and well presented, it was also very quiet. The rooms are small but pefectly fine for a couple like us. The bathroom is also very small, but was clean and had towels and soap,etc provided. The room has a radiator which is easy to use, which we found helpful after coming in from the rain! Beds are comfy. TV in the room, and tea/coffee making facilties although limited. Staff are polite and helpful. would go again. Ps - the hotel is in a fab area and you can go anywhere you like in amsterdam by hopping on the tram outside

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rowena100
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, 15 mins walk to the centre and easy tram ride to all museums. Rooms were clean and area quiet, great to come back to after a night on the town. All hotels were expensive but felt this was good value, room was a good size, the bathroom was a little small but clean and adequate for use. My only critism is that on the days when my boyfriend and I slept in our room was not cleaned when we left - obviously the cleaners only made one round?! Overall the staff were helpful and even printed our return plane tickets for us, I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy, but good overall.”
Reviews.Author: Gwen B
Reviews.Content: Was here for one night with a friend. We had a voucher and thus we stayed here for free, which already made me have low expectations. Normally, when you're staying for free you don't get the best rooms in the house. This was also the case here. Our room was on ground level, right next to the door and the reception. This made for quite some nuisance as guests pressed the door bell in the middle of the night. We didn't have breakfast included, but I suspect we also were right next to (or at least close to) the breakfast room. Around 6.30AM there were several noises of kitchen equipment, which didn't stop. Also around 8.00AM they started vacuum cleaning. The staff was very friendly and helpful (free amsterdam plans!).They also have a luggage room and although it is kinda shady and they have no proper system to check whether you actually should be there, it worked for us. Public transport stops just a few hundred meters away. I assume you'll get les noisy rooms when you actually pay for your stay, which would make it a great hotel for a stay during a citytrip.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel, spoilt a great trip”
Reviews.Author: Frankie789
Reviews.Content: At first, we were put in a basement room. This room was number 9 and it was terrible. I've stayed in some small rooms in NYC, but this took the biscuit. It's actually the same size as a cabin on MoD ships - difficult and uncomfortable to move in; not relaxing at all. The room was poorly finished with gaps and cracks in the tiling. The bathroom was a cupboard and my partner couldn't stand up in the shower as the ceiling was so low (he's tall, but not massive - 6'5") but even if he was 6'11" you'd expect the ceiling to be tall enough! The first night was spent in a very comfortable bed - pity I was woken up at 6am by the noise of pedestrians, eventually a garbage truck, the only cars in amsterdam and the awful smell of tobacco smoke - the window is right above the bed and its so small you can't close the vents as it gets very hot. I complained and got moved to the 2nd floor - much bigger room and the ceiling was a normal height - great! There was no apology at all. This room was better but small things like stained carpets, no teaspoons and the heating not working for over an hour when we got caught in a downpour were not great for the price. To be honest, I'd recommend staying in an ibis rather than this place! On a positive note. It's in a lovely area - very pretty and the zoo is close. Amsterdam is a very beautiful place and we walked from one end of the city to the other in a surprisingly short amount of time. The transport system is great also. By all means go to Amsterdam, but don't go to the Eden Lancaster!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Frank J
Reviews.Content: Recently visited the Eden Lancaster Hotel. Arrived before check in time but was allocated a room within 10 mins. The room was a very big room with 4 beds and a large bathroom. Only drawback was a very dirty carpet. Staff very very helpfull. Lots of trams into Amsterdam. Must buy 1 or 2 day pass for trams.Would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: ChelleyBurgh
Reviews.Content: This place is basic but served its purpose very well, rooms were really big and beds were comfy, bathrooms quite small with just a shower but fitted our needs perfectly, our room was on same level as reception but at the far end, Honestly though walls are a little thin but didnt really affect us. We wanted somewhere slightly outside the hustle as we had visited amsterdam many times before. this was great location in a leafy street close to Zoo, there is a stunning wee chinese on this street where i had the best ever food. this is a very good base for sightseeing and far enough away where street noise isnt a problem

Reviews.Title: “A box of rubbish”
Reviews.Author: putco
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel and was given a room below floor level with a window, that doesn't open, at pavement level. Every person, bicycle, car and tram that comes past roars into the room making it impossible to sleep. There is no air-conditioning so there is no air. The bed is old and the springs are coming through and the bathroom smells of urine. This hotel cost me the same for two nights as a 5 star hotel on the Strip in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as it seems”
Reviews.Author: 2708Rachel
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and in an accessible part of Amsterdam, 10/15 mins from Dam Square/Central Station by Tram but if you're looking for luxury this is not the hotel for you. As two couples staying for 3 nights over the bank holiday weekend we would have probably made more of the hotel's breakfast & dinner options however all I wanted to do after staying overnight was go outdoors......Both couples were allocated rooms at either end of a corridor and right by the lifts. The rooms were booked as doubles but twin beds were provided, okay you would say, but not if there was a 3 inch height difference & one was solid as rock & the other like a sponge! Our room was also next to the housekeepers storage, so each morning it was opening and closing every few minutes, okay if you are an early riser but we're not. To top it off on day 2 (9.30am) & day 3 (8am) we were woke to the sound of the maintenance man drilling & sawing in the yard below. No point asking to be moved as the man on the desk wasnt very helpful when our friend asked where to by cigarettes, he went next door to the very nice cafe instread.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dutchamericanfamily5
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and family friendly. We were traveling with a 3 and 5 year old. The staff was extremely helpful and took care of everything we needed including overnight parking, where to eat, etc. The breakfast was great - lots of variety, we loved it. The staff was very helpful with our food allergies. The only complaint was the size of the room. We had a 4 person room which was basically a standard room with a couch that pulled out into a bed. The couch was fine for kids (didn't seem comfortable for anyone over 90 pounds!), but when open there was little room to walk anywhere. We were constantly bumping into things, stubbing our toes, etc. But the room was clean and nice. We were on the 1st floor by the steps in the back, which was a bit noisy, but it didn't really bother us. Location was great! Quiet area, but very close to the tram. May cafes withing walking distance. Short tram ride to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been much better.”
Reviews.Author: Allison B
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews however was very disappointed when I arrived. The staff on reception were efficient but not particularly friendly! The first room we were in was in the basement and was tiny, barely any room to move and bathroom cramped. The carpet was extremely grubby! I asked to be moved and was told as they were full I would be moved the following day - I had also requested a double bed but had two singles. Beware - the beds are really soft and the sleeping experience is rotten. Being in the basement we could hear everything above us - it felt like our upstairs neighbour was in the same room! The following day we were moved to a larger room on the third floor - which has 4 single beds in it. The room was much nicer and my overall experience would have been much better if we had been put in this room in the first place. Disappointing that there is such a difference between rooms. On checkout the staff again were efficient but did not ask if we had a nice stay! I wouldn't go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Average and expensive compared to the Eden Rembrandt”
Reviews.Author: sossick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Eden Rembrandt on our last visit which was a much higher spec so were rather disapppointed on arrival the the Lancaster. Our room was rather small but clean and the bed was comfy. The shower room was tiny, and rather shabby. No bar or even a mini bar. Overall we found the hotel to be really expensive. Almost Â£450 just for 3 nights. The location was fine - very quite but a coupel of bars just down the road, and about 10 min walk into the centre.

Reviews.Title: “would go back but only for short stay”
Reviews.Author: ArndKaiser
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was about as wide as it was high with barely enough room to open a suit case. On the toilet you could only sit sideways for lack of space. The antiquated shower stall showed some mildew and water pressure was non existent. The room, situated towards the rear of the building was clean and without street noise. Breakfast was exceptional however, offering almost everything you could think of. We found this to be the case in other European establishments. While by North American standards the three stars are a bit of a stretch, the location - within 10 walking minutes of the centre of the city - was perfect,...!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy room, good location”
Reviews.Author: TViktor
Reviews.Content: We liked the small but practically furnished/equipped room. Especially the bed was very comfortable. There was a water heater and some tea bags/instant coffee provided in the room that made it more comfortable. The city center is in walking distance, but the neighborhood is very silent. There is a direct tram line from the central station to the hotel. What we didn't like is the smell coming from the toilet, and filled the air in the lobby. There was no such problem in our room. Even this problem got resolved in three days. Also be prepared that they are putting a deposit on your debit card at arrival that is the whole charge of your stay plus 200EUR. At leaving they remove the deposit and charge the correct amount. Breakfast is not served in the hotel, and they charge 15EUR per person per day. We had breakfast in the nearby breakfast places (1/2 minutes walk) for 13EUR for both of us.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most disappointing stays I have had in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GreyAsh2
Reviews.Content: Having read great reviews of this hotel, I was looking forward to a relaxing stay in a comfortable room, choosing it over cheaper hotels in the centre. I was therefore very disappointed with my experience - I think I have only once ever stayed in a worse hotel room. The room itself is my main complaint. It was far too small to be comfortable. There was only a foot gap between the end of the bed and the wall - and in walking down this gap to get to the other side of the bed (the only space large enough to place luggage) I had to duck under the television that was hanging from the wall. Once I had put my luggage down there was no room for me to manoeuvre in the space; the only other space was the wardrobe, but to fit one of my suitcases in there, I needed to perch the electric fan from the wardrobe on top of my suitcase, and then had no room for my clothes. The beds were not in line with the headboard - I assume they had had to be moved over in order to be able to open the front door and the bathroom door, and as a result, one of the reading lights was directly over my pillow. Someone else had obviously already had problems with this lack of space, as the plastic of the light was broken, and it was dangling down with it's cables on show. The bathroom was just as bad. The toilet was cramped between the shower and the wall - so to sit on the toilet, I had to have one leg pushed against the wall, and the other in the shower, which would not have been so much of a problem if I could have pushed the shower curtain out of the way, but it was held in place just where my knee needed to go. On top of this, the safe in the room did not work, and the fire escape details in the room were broken, I assume hit by someone's suitcase. When going down to breakfast I found broken tape which seemed to have been a no entry - and a sign, not particularly obvious, saying no entry, construction site (or something similar) so I had to ask at reception, where they told me I had to take a different route to breakfast. The breakfast itself was satisfactory, but at 15 Euros, far too expensive. That following day I got up early, having slept well (the bed was comfortable, but the pillows not), but on arriving back at my room after 2pm, found that it had not been cleaned; this was the final straw, so I decided to ask if I could move room. The receptionist told me that he would have to check if my room had been serviced, and made a call. Then he told me I couldn't change room as it had been serviced already!!!! That did not go down very well, but he quickly agreed to let me change room, after I told him it had definitely not been serviced. Initially he offered me a room for 25 Euros more! But when I told him I was not willing to pay more, he offered me a different room for the same price. This new room, although still small, was an acceptable size, with nothing broken - and only the grubby carpets (as were also in the first room) letting the room down. Finally, I left my luggage in the left luggage room - having been told the room was open. I assumed it had just been unlocked, but when I returned later, I realised that actually the room had been left unlocked all day, and anyone could have walked in and taken my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel... value for money”
Reviews.Author: deepu_uk
Reviews.Content: I was initially skeptical after reading some of the review but when i went there things were completely different the overall service was awesome needless to say i will definitely stay the next time i visit Amsterdam. superb hotel, friendly staff, close to the city center, clean rooms, breakfast spread was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, good location”
Reviews.Author: NYCmama
Reviews.Content: but the rugs were a bit dirty. Beds were comfortable. Room was quiet. Location was lovely

Reviews.Title: “Lousy tired hotel, with well meaning and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: JeffersLondon
Reviews.Content: My first room was TINY with a severe lack of ventillation, a stuffy and damp smell and no airconditioning (the lack of air con was not the hotel's fault, just something that I had expected to find) The two single beds seemed to be far too soft and thankfully I was moved to the basement, room 005 as this was the only free one. The room was far larger (having 4 single beds) and cooler but was below ground level and suffered from noise from the street. The un-openable windows looked out on peoples feet as they walked past. The noise from the street was annoying at best. The carpets looked filthy and my sheets weren't changed over the three nights that I stayed there. Perhaps this is normal. The towels were OK, the TV was good, the bathroom was tiny and the tiles were dirty. The worst thing about this room was that there was noise from a sewage pipe every time other rooms flushed their toilets. This was a horrible thing to have to listen to. The single bed was SO overly soft and "knackered" that my back is still aching 36 hours after leaving. Also, I asked for a room with a double bed. I am not sure if there are any in this hotel. The great thing about room 005 is that you can get free wi-fi if you are in the right position. Pretty much everything else is bad. The position isn't good for the centre as you either need to get a tram (2.4 euros) or a cab (costing from 7.5 to 15 euros). There's a lovely coffee shop next door... "Coffee to Walk" I won't be returning here!

Reviews.Title: “Was ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: lj241290
Reviews.Content: it was alright the bathroom was small, there is only wifi in the lobby and it was very slow but it was priced pretty well so cant complain to much

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: stephg1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 3 friends over the weekend & we had some trepidation having read the reports. We have spent less money in Madrid, Barcelona etc & had fantastic accomodation so we were prepared to be disappointed. We arrived early & rooms were ready. Receptionist very helpful, pointed out places on map & suggested somewhere for breakfast if we didn't want to eat there- (Sapori) few steps away-very pleasant owner. Bedroom was rather compact but had tea & coffee which we didn't expect. Carpet was a bit stained. Bed was really comfy with 2 fat pillows. Enough hangers, even for 2 girls. Our view looked over a small park at the back. The bathroom was cramped with a very strange design of toilet bowl but we had clean towels every day & our room was cleaned well. The area around is fine. Doesn't take long to walk into the centre- or you can hop on the canal boat on a pretty stretch of the canal a few steps from the hotel, We had pretty ropey weather whilst we were there but it did not stop us doing what we wanted to do. Loved the canal trips, Anne Frank Huis & the quirky coffee shops. I don't know why accomodation is so pricey in Amsterdam -can only assume not a lot of it. Go with an open mind, watch out for mad cyclists & trams and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: pat1680
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is overall expensive and low quality, as far as accommodation is concerned, so this review has to be taken in context. Fact is that this hotel is not particularly clean (bathroom sink, toilet, bed covers... not properly cleaned), the bed was very uncomfortable (totally worn out mattress, synthetic sheets that made you sweat no matter which way you lay), breakfast overpriced. They have no wireless internet connection: you pay 5â‚¬ an hour for a wired connection that is as slow as modems in the 90s. In any other city, this hotel would not have any customers, but given Amsterdam standards, they can get away with it... I do think you'd be better off staying in a cheaper hostel - they are the same quality, but at a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was all too brief”
Reviews.Author: JLeo25
Reviews.Content: Only two nights in Amsterdam for business purposes, but the Eden Lancaster was an excellent choice. My room was roomy by European standards, reasonably priced, in a central and accessible location. The staff was especially courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: mcshazz
Reviews.Content: I booked our trip as a surprise for my fiance's 30th birthday and we had a fantastic time. I took great care in selecting this hotel. It is a little out of town but that is what I wanted. It takes 5-10 minutes on the tram to get into town and we even walked to central station from the hotel on our last day (due to a tram strike) which only took 30 minutes at a leisurely pace. The area is quiet and away from the hustle and bustle - perfect for couples and families. We were welcomed immediately when we arrived by a polite and pleasant young man. We stayed in room 208. The hotel rooms in Amsterdam are generally quite small but we didn't need a large room. Our double bed was two twin beds pushed together but this is common practice in hotels (I worked in hotels for years while I was at university) and makes sense. We were given two single duvets instead of a double which we actually really liked! No fighting for covers (we may implement this at home!). The bed and pillows were supersoft and we were reluctant to get out of bed in the morning. When we arrived back to the hotel each day our room was clean and tidy - we didn't have to ask for anything. Breakfast wasn't included in our room rate which we knew. Initially we thought that 15 euros per person was quite expensive but it is actually pretty good value compared to what we would have had to pay in a restaurant for the same meal. The quality and selection of food was great - sausages, bacon, eggs, breads, cheeses, meats, spreads, jams and a selection of hot and cold juices. The breakfast staff were excellent as well - efficient and friendly. I'd recommend this hotel to most people. However, if you're planning wild nights out then don't stay here. The trams stop around 12.30 and a taxi will cost around 12 euros. My fiance is returning to Amsterdam in April for his stag weekend and probably won't stay at the Eden Lancaster for this reason. In saying that, he and his friends are keen to stay at one of the more central Eden hotels instead. A lot of people will always try to find something to complain about wherever they stay. The hotel isn't right in the centre of town but it doesn't claim to be. It is on more than one tram route though and the trams run every 6 minutes through the day and every 10 minutes at night. The rooms aren't large but you'll be hard pushed to find a large room for the same price in Amsterdam. The double beds will be two singles pushed together but you can't tell the difference anyway. All in all, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get to, quiet place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: oldprune
Reviews.Content: Location was great! Previous reviewers are correct - easy to get to, quiet section of city. The room was small - had just enough room to walk around the bed. Bathroom was sufficient. Breakfast is self-serving buffet style with typical European menu. Only problem is I got the bed with wire poking from matress! I read about this.... the staff wanted us to pack up all our belongings in the morning before we leave and it was too much trouble so I decided to tough it up. They did not have comment card in the hotel - they said that the are getting it from other hotel - yea, I am sure. But aver all, if the price is right, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - Not the best”
Reviews.Author: ellewoodruff
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to this hotel over christmas time 2010. When i arrived I was ordered to pay a 50 deposit because and i quote ' People have been smoking in the room, if you are found to have smoked then you will not recieve it back' so reluctantly i paid the fee. When i got to our room the curtain nets were full of burns from cigerettes and there were lots of butts outside our window. The bathroom facilities were ok but very very small and connected directly to the room so make sure you are comfortable with whoever your staying with! The man at reception and the only member of staff i saw was very rude to me throughout my stay starting with the fee at the beggining. The hotel reception is very nice but again small, and i read when booking that they provided free wifi which for me did not work and the man behind reception was not helpful at all!! The best part of the hotel was our bed it was very comfortable and regularly changed, the images of the rooms are how they appear in real life. To be honest it was quite expensive and i wasnt happy with mainly the treatment i recieved from the receptionist but apart from that its not a bad hotel. Trams operate right outside to amsterdam centre but is a bit annoying having to get on them all the time (and there was heavy snow which stopped them completely), if i were you book near the town centre unless you like the zoo which is opposite!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Rob19822891
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but modern and comfortable. The hotel in general is in a good state of repair all over. Staff were a little snooty, but they probably get a lot of stick from English guys around my age so I can kind of understand it. The location is probably the best thing about the hotel. It is situated on a nice tree lined road, away from the hustle and bustle and tack of the tourist areas but within easy walking distance. An enjoyable, simple 15 minute walk takes you to Nieuwmarkt and the centre of the tourist area. You can also walk there from the central station pretty easily. I didn't eat breakfast but at â‚¬10 a head it seemed expensive. All in all a positive experience and I wouldnâ€™t avoid this hotel in the future should I wish to spend the same amount.

Reviews.Title: “before making a reservation be sure to ask where your room is located”
Reviews.Author: jazzair
Reviews.Content: Location is very close to tram stop for number 9 and 14 trams. The size and cleanliness of the rooms were OK. The beds are too soft, if you have problem with your back, you definitely will have a backache in the morning. The tv and technology in the room is from 90's. Interior decoration at lobby etc. is very old-fashioned. Our room was on street level, however the hotel entrance and reception is one level above the street level. So, after you checkin you take stairs to carry your luggages to the basement where your room is located (no elevator access). Pass through narrow corridor. It felt like checking in to a submarine. For elder persons be sure to doublecheck that your room is on upper levels with elevator access. When we arrived at 13.00 we could not check in. This was our bad hotel policy and reservation form indicates that the check out time is 15:00. So take this into account. (actually isn't it a bit late for a check-in; but this might be a general rule in all hotels in the city, I don't know) Oddly enough, some of the hotel staff acts like, they are making you a favor to let you stay there. Room rates = 2 x the level of service you expect from a hotel charging these room rates. Room rates = 1,3 x the comfort & technology of rooms. .

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel as a base- if you dont mind noise/small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jeann24
Reviews.Content: From the airport: Easy to get to hotel from the airport- Just hop on the train to central station (ticket 4.20 each brought at station)from the airport then once at central station get the number 9 tram to plantage kerklann. We brought a four day travel pass for the trams only 19.50 Euros! (brought outside central station in one of the tourist shops) so cheap compared to london! the tram stops on the same road as the hotel then jst wall down the road and its there. Location: Ideally located if you want to keep away from noise etc at night but close to everything. About 10-15 minute walk to dam square or just get on the number 9 tram takes only 5 mins. Good location overall. Opposite the ZOO and next to a small park. Arrived at the Eden Lancaster hotel about 1pm told rooms would not be ready for another hour and a half or so, receiptionist offerd the use of a luggage room to keep our bags as we set of for a few hours till room ready. Finally got in room and was quite disappointed- as opend our door and door hit the bed which was right up against the window additionally toilet door was right next to bed! tiny room that couldnt even walk around the room! I know Amsterdam hotels rooms are known to be small but this was ridicoulous! Also the noise of the tram going ding ding ding every 3 minuites i kknew would drive me crazy- so went back to reception and asked for another room. The man kindly gave us another room with no fuss. Second room a little bit better, we could actually walk around the room and no noise as room was positioned at the back of the hotel overlooking residential flats. Only same problem was the bathroom! it is right next the the bed and there is a step up and their is a big gap invetween the door and floor- so you have to be pretty close to your travell companion as you hear everything! The room was a proper double bed which was nice for a change in european hotels! comfy too with good pillows! the bathroom was only a shower with hairdryer but very small and could do with updating. Additionally as mentioned in other reviews the carpet was really filthy! The hotel does do breakfast but this was 15 euros each and we didnt try it. along the road there are loads of lovely little cafes which did some smashing scrambled eggs! or go to Rambrant square where there are loads of restraunts and cafes from breakfast to dinner lovely sitting outside tables. The hotel as wireless internet that we could only acces from the reception area. On check out had to pay the city tax which for 4 days was arounf 14 euros. Recommded trips: Definatly recommend visting the de hortus botanical gardens only around the corner (1 tram stop) only 7.50 euro entry and you could if ya like spend all day in there! was gorgeous loads to see. Also recommed doing the pizza cruise at 7pm takes you around all the canals for 1 half hours and you order a dominos pizza and hagen daz ice cream and its deliverds to the boat! Also Van gough museum was very good. Loads of other weird and wacky things to see. Amsterdam is a must see, my opinion is its the best city ive ever been to! and very romantic too!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Karseat
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Eden Lancaster over a weekend break. We were on a tight budget but did not want to compromise our comfort as we are both fussy sleepers. We were pleasantly surprised by our great stay- the room was small but not cramped, and it was clean and quiet. An added bonus was how nicely decorated the room was- I actually felt like I was in Amsterdam, not the usual generic hotel feel. The staff were polite and helpful. For the price especially, this is a great hotel, we will stay here next time we are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm Iwould think twice”
Reviews.Author: kkltd
Reviews.Content: After arriving at check In I was informed they don't have my booking on their system. Then they made my friend and I seem like we're were lying and we could not have a room until they found It. We were asked to wait and It would not be long. It was 40mins before we were allowed to see our 106 euro room. We finally got the key too discover that It was not the room that was advertised on a 3rd party site. It was a much smaller twin room. The receptionist did her best to help at this point but they only had three rooms left. Overall very Disappointed with their customer service and false advertising and will never return. 20 min walk to city centre.

Reviews.Title: “One step above a hostel.”
Reviews.Author: Trillium3
Reviews.Content: Eden Lancaster is on a bus line and is across the street from Artis, the city zoo. It has an elevator, so no need to haul luggage up a flight of stairs, as at many low cost hotels in Amsterdam. The staff is pleasant and professional. Our room was tiny. The major flaw was that the carpet was filthy. The sound of herons and flamingos from the zoo was a pleasant addition. We saw a lot of young people there, but it wasn't noisy. Breakfast was good. Everything in Amsterdam is pricey. This is a safe, convenient, relatively inexpensive hotel, but don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: natalie2101
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Eden Lancaster hotel. It was very clean, the rooms were a good size. The location is about a mile from the centre and the trams are frequent, however if you would rather walk there is a short cut directly to the centre, which takes about ten minutes. The service was very good. We did not try the food, but heard no complaints. We didn't have to pay any tax on leaving the hotel. All in all a very nice hotel for a short stay in the city, close to the centre, but far enough away from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money & very good service.”
Reviews.Author: Avi4484
Reviews.Content: We really enjoid our stay in Eden Lancaster hotel. Our reservation included breakfast that was very nice, with variety of cheese sausages, egs and fruits. There was also automatic coffee machine and fresh guise. The rooms are a bit small, but it's ok because when we arrived to the room we already too tired and "fell" on the bed into a sweet sleep. We would like to mention 2 staff thet gave us the best service we got in Europe! (we can't remember names, sorry) the first one is the lady in the breakfast room thet were there every day. We enjoid here great service and smile. The second one is the lady in the front desk (the kibbutz girl) thet helped us so much.

Reviews.Title: “Eden Lancaster Hotel Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: cariad1981
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very smart for a 3 star hotel, the hotel is 20 mins walking distance from the city centre. The staff speak several languages quiet fluently , so it makes it easier for foreign customers like myself. If you have choosen only acomodation option, i may say that just next door from the hotel is a fantastic modern and cheap cafe , ( my sugestion is to try the red pesto, tomato and melted cheese panini ) . As ive been working myself for a long time in 5 star hotel receptions, I will love to give you my feedback and how you could improve even more the reception team service, So every time i come in or out of the hotel, i never saw anyone at the front desk, they were always at the back office, so sometimes i was wating there around 5 mins to be seen. Maybe a bell will solve this problem, or just do the paper work in the front, it will help to improve security for the customers and staff. Also i tought that the check in introduction was very poor, my advice is a friendly smile at the arrival and then ask the customer if they need any maps, or any information about local ameneties. Also, they are missing an upsell oppourtunity by not offering any excursions through the hotel, i instead had to arrange and pay for these myself. Being a stranger to the area, i would have liked to have been offered these by the hotel instaead of arranging them through vendors that i was unfamiliar with. If you are going on holiday here, i would suggest to take a GPS on any taxi ride as the drivers enjoy taking the scenic route!!!!!! This unfortunately happened to me on most of my taxi journeys.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms and loud noises at night”
Reviews.Author: oooooooUk
Reviews.Content: Location was great, could walk to everywhere we wanted to go but our room was right next to the lobby and we had a terrible night because all we could hear was people talking really loudly and terrible, loud lobby music. Basically clean and comfortable but the toilet smelt quite bad and the room in itself was insanely small as was the bathroom, not great over all. The breakfast is really expensive but there's a really nice cheap cafe just a few doors down. Free internet in the lobby was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for location, value and Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: RDSMS
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day break in Amsterdam staying at the Eden Lancaster. The hotel is in a great position just 15 mins walk to Dam Square and gave good value along with a relaxed quiet setting from which to enjoy our break Our room (214) offered good views across a small park, was clean and comfortable albeit the walls were a bit thin, as we heard the alarm from next door going off at 7am. Keeping your luggage whilst you enjoy your last day was very pleasing. The only negative from the hotel service was that our room was not cleaned one morning, however the receptionist resolved the issue well and ensured we were satisfied with the outcome. Get the tram pass to get the best out of your stay here as the trams are so frequent its like hailing a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Jake-Millie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 night for a leisure trip. We did not pay much for the package deals (flight+hotel) but were very satisfied for what we got for our money. The hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly enough. The room was small but well presented, it had a modern feel to it and gave off a good first impression. The bathroom was very small but it was more than enough for a couple. The only small gripe we had was that the beds were two singles pushed together, not a major issue but it would have been nice to have had a proper full sized double bed. It was a 15 minute walk to the center of the city (Damn Square), the walk is pleasant along the canals and had a safe feel about the area. If you do not want to walk it is easy enough to get a tram (directly outside hotel) or it would be cheap to get a taxi. The breakfast at the hotel was not included however they often give vouchers for half price at reception so make sure you ask for these. The normal price for the buffet breakfast is 20 euros per person but we ended up paying 10 each as we claimed we had a voucher. The breakfast consisted of fresh bread, croissants, scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, salami, salads, cereals and various other meats and cheeses. It was a tad pricey if you pay the full 20 euros but at 10 euros it is a fair enough price. Overall we (I was traveling with my girlfriend) were both more than happy with the hotel for the price we paid and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, peaceful hidden little jewl”
Reviews.Author: fun-fun97
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 3 night very comfterbal stay at the Eden Lancaster (21/2 - 24/2 2011 ). This is a lovely hotel just outside of the centre of Dam in a very quite location right opposite the zoo and beside a park area. The hotel is situated next to a small bakery and few quire bars! The tram no 9 from central station drops you almost right outside the hotel ! It is about a 10 min walk to the main area which has everything you could ask for! Our room was room 306 and looked over the street and park area. The room was very small , that small infact that the bathroom door hit the bed as you opened it. However the room had all we needed, comfy bed, dressing table, mirror, tea / cofee making facility, the bathroom was a reasonable size with a large shower, plenty of clean towels and hairdryer. The Only neagative to the bathroom was that there is a small rise like a step into the bathroom that you sometimes forget that is there and causes you to trip and could potentialy cause you an accident if you do trip hard ! The room was always kept warm with heating on which was a blessing as it was freezing in Amsterdam it was that cold on wednesday that it snowed! My only negative to the actual bedroom area was that the carpet seemed quite dirty and had quite a few stains so I was pleased that I brought my slippers with me! Overall this is a good hotel and I would defo stay here again ! Please note when you depart from the hotel you have to pay a tourist tax of 7.50 Euros for the pleasure of visiting! Oh and one more thing please beware the price of things in Amsterdam are quite expensive in the centre due to the euro and being a tourist! For example 1 beer and a barcardi and cloke cost us 14.50 euro ! All in all a great place that we would visit again !

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: rossellamaffi
Reviews.Content: We came back from Amsterdam on 22nd feb, after 3 nights in this hotel: room is big enough for two, with modern style , evene if we were at ground floor no noise from the street !!! The room is warm and you can decide the temperature. Carpet on the floor, nice picture, bathroom very very very small, but is ok if you want to stay few days, we use the room only to sleep and wash , the rest of the day in centre or in museum. Breakfast is very fine: croissants, egg, cheese, fruits, cereals, bacon, cappuccino, coffee, everything to start in a fantastic way :) The hotel is near to the city centre, 10-15 minutes walking or you can rent bike directly at the hotel and in 2 minutes you are in the centre. In front of the hotel there is tram stop line 9 for central station. I really recomended for those who are looking for a nice hotel near the city centre and not so expensive ...then it's up to your budget ;)

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel, room a little small but great value”
Reviews.Author: johnp37
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 10 minutes walk from Rembrandt Square in a quiet neighborhood just opposite the Zoo. Getting around from here was no problem as the tram stopped almost outside and therefore nothing in the Centre was more than 15 minutes away. The only negative thing was that the room was slightly too small for the 4 of us but it was comfortable. Breakfast was pretty good and the staff were very helpful..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Amy_Nurse_90
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect stay for my boyfriend and I for 2 nights. It was located about 10minutes walk from most of the main attractions and across the road from Artis Zoo. It was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful and the bed very comfortable. Hotel was quiet and had no sleep disturbances. I would definitely recommend this hotel as we had no problems at all! Amsterdam is a beautiful city and it was better to have a hotel located 10minutes outside of Dam square and the main attractions as we seen quite a lot when we walked in and out of town everyday and found a lovely coffee shop for breakfast each morning. Only negative comment and it didnt bother us, is that the bathrooms are very small so anyone who is travelling with children, maybe ask for a room with a bigger bathroom if its available, otherwise 10/10!

Reviews.Title: “Minimal but worth the money for a restful stay”
Reviews.Author: marygeralyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden Lancaster for New Years because of its good reviews and very cheap price. Here's the rundown: Pros: - Location: If you want to sleep in Amsterdam, this is the place for you. Most of Amsterdam is very loud with parties until 6am. The Eden Lancaster is located a 10 minute walk from where the action is happening (or a very expensive tram). Being that it's off the strip and across the street from the zoo, it was completely silent. - Price: We paid ~$75USD a night. Can't beat that in such an expensive city. - Free Wi-Fi and a free computer in the lobby . - Breakfast: Delicious... but see below. Cons: - Rooms: The size of the room was comical. From sitting on the bed, you can touch all walls with your feet. The bathroom was an even more hilarious. While sitting on the toilet, your knees will touch the wall. To brush your teeth, you'll have to open the door. And, the shower is so small that you can't lift your arms without knocking into the wall or curtain. - Breakfast: Long story short, we asked the breakfast attendant if breakfast was free; she said it was. We said, "Great!" and chowed down every morning. When we went to checkout, the front desk told us we owed $15 euro per person per day. I explained to him that we were told it was free, to which he responded, "but it wasn't." I told him that wasn't my problem and I wasn't paying him. This went on for about 10 minutes, and I stood my ground (like any good New Yorker). Finally, after his failed attempt at offering me 50% off, he said, "fine." - Service: The people at the front desk were not very nice. They didn't greet you with a smile, didn't want to be bothered, and had to Google simple things like "where's a pancake house." - Parking: At over $40 Euro a day to park on the street, my Belgian friend parked way down the street in a public lot for free. By morning, his car had three windows broken. Don't drive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent New Year”
Reviews.Author: vicky123c
Reviews.Content: we had a great time in Amsterdam, The Eden Lancaster was all good, yes the rooms are very small but you only sleep there, they still have tv and brewing tackle, everything you need. the staff were very friendly and hotel itself very clean. Perhaps only downside is it doesnt have a bar , you end up spending loads on the vending machine in reception. great cafe next door - coffee to walk ! although this hotel is slightly out of the centre its still in great location, the trams stop outside, tram number 9 or 14. I recommend you get a ticket to cover your full stay, i got a 4 day ticket from tourist office at central station for 19euros this covers all trams and buses (not airport train) well worth it as i must of used the trams about 10 times a day. great transport system. hotel is within walking distance of main squares too - well 20 mins / 30 mins walk if necessary. amsterdam is full of shops, cafes and restaurants, plenty to do and such an amzing city. loved it. would def. go back to eden lancaster.

Reviews.Title: “Very dated hotel with small rooms and ensuite facilities.”
Reviews.Author: carol_trower
Reviews.Content: We were put into this hotel due to over booking in the hotel of our choice. We booked a double room/bed but the room we were given was in fact twin beds of different heights put together. The room itself was very depressing with out dated wall paper, poor lightening and poor attention to cleanliness. It was also very small (no room to swing a cat comes to mind) and the "shower room" was only a cupboard with no room to sit on the tolilet without knees pressed against the wall and certainly no space to get dressed or undressed in order to use the shower. Locating the shower gel was not productive as the shower gel container was empty. The door to this cupboard was 12 cms from the bedroom floor - so you needed to know your room mate very well to cope with noises from this area. The door to the bedroom also did not fit thereby letting in a great deal of light and noise from the hotel corridor. In an attempt to sleep we had to try and cover the gaps with coats and spare pillows. Street lights were also a problem as the curtain was hung 15 cms from the actual window. The bed however was comfortable but the lumpy pillow was not conductive to sleep. The hotel did provide tea and coffee making facilaities but due to the dust on the kettle - this facility was not used by us. So after a sleepless night we were pleasantly surprised to find the breakfast was of a high standard with a large variety of foods. But we cancelled the 2nd night in this hotel and on contacting our travel agent in the UK they were able to transfer us to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Rigordol
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny but clean. Good location, about twenty minutes to walk to the main sites. There is a tram station near the hotel, the metro station is about ten minutes to walk. Our room was very noisy because it was on the same floor of the reception, with people talked untill late in the evening; we asked the receptionist if she could close the door of the hall but we were told that for safety reasons, the door must remain open until midnight. Our window looked out on the main road but this wasn't a problem. The bathroom was the smallest I ever seen, but was clean. The double bed was actually two single beds pushed together but was confortable. Definetly a discreet hotel, but I guess with he same price you can find a better deal in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, but don't stay at their sister hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DohaGypsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eden Lancaster for 8 days in October ( a beautiful time of year to be in Amsterdam) and we enjoyed it. The rooms were tiny, but clean and cozy, and the location was excellent. However our first night their they sent us to their sister hotel, the Eden Leidesplein, for whatever reason, and this hotel was no where near the quality of the Lancaster, it was actually worse than hostels I stayed at in my teens. The room was old, dirty and smelled like an ash tray. The shower curtain was dirty and the toilet hadn't been flushed. We were glad to get out of there and I truley don't believe we should have paid for that night, however the desk clerk ignored my complaints. So while I recommend the Eden Lancaster I can't emphasize enough that you do not stay or let them send you to the Eden Leidesplein.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: thetri0
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my boyfriends birthday as a surprise, knowing that he is quite fussy about where he stays i was worried about what it would be like... but was pleasantly surprised when i got there, the rooms and whole hotel were exactly as they looked on the website. Everywhere was very clean and well presented. We had a basic room and it was very comfortable and clean. The room was quite small but had everything that we needed including a tv, kettle and drink making facillities and a safe in the wardrobe so we didnt need to carry all of our belongings with us and we knew they would be safe. The beds were comfortable and actually had 3 soft pillows rather than the usual one hard pillow you get at hotels. It was approx 15-20 min walk to get the main attractions. Artis zoo is opposite the hotel and a quiet little park to the right. Overall it was a pleasant stay and i would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Brian_de_Kilburn
Reviews.Content: Competent hotel in a quiet quarter of Amsterdam. Half an hour walk to most of the main sites, and two useful trams run outside the hotel. Rather dull buffet breakfast. Free wifi in the lobby. They charge for it in your room, but I found you could get the lobby signal in mine on the third floor. My room was comfortable, an agreeably decorated but the water pressure was too low for a decent shower. No bath with my room. I had a room on the main road with trams running past during the night, but I didnâ€™t find it disturbing. Two nice brown cafes nearby for a drink or a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, has everything needed for a stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tdawber
Reviews.Content: Check in was very welcoming. Make sure you check around the side of the elevator, there are some discount cards on the wall, 50% off Tulip Museum etc. Great transport links into the city centre, tram 9 and 14, takes about 5 minutes via tram to get to Dam square. Discounted 1hr canal tour with Lovers at reception at 8 euros, (12.50 if you book with Lovers) make sure you check out the deals at reception. You can get your tram transport cards from reception 24hrs, 48 hrs or 72 hrs, and also purchase van gogh museum tickets from reception in advance, so you dont have to wait in line at the museum. TV has good cable, BBC1 and BBC2 among other english channels like comedy and animal planet and also good radio station selection. Lots of extras for a 3 star hotel, free wifi and vending machines in reception are a good addition. Doors are noisy, but for a very comfortable stay in amsterdam away from the hustle and bustle of the city i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasant experience! Quality absolutely doesnâ€™t correspond to the price!”
Reviews.Author: BellaTania
Reviews.Content: Very unpleasant experience! Quality absolutely doesnâ€™t correspond to the price! Superior room what we were given is in terrible conditions: dirty carpet, shabby walls and furniture, bathroom very small with no normal lighting. It was needed to overcome the sense of disgust before to enter to the shower without a slippers (the curtain of the shower and the floor of it were dirty). The bed was so uncomfortable with the mattress from the times of the World War I probably; to sleep on it was completely impossible. We have stayed there 1 night, if You will stay longer, there is a certain risk that after you will need to visit a physical therapist in order to avoid problems with your back. Moreover, it looks like the price of the room depends on the receptionist who is on turn...Despite the reservation confirmation what we had, the guy on reception desk was going to charge for the room 100 EUR more than it was stated in the confirmation. Without saying any excuse for his mistake then. After one night in this place we were decided to leave and on checking-out we were taken nevertheless another sum (higher than it was stated in confirmation blank) and the receptionist was very surprised on our earlier departure on which he noticed, that we CAN NOT TO LEAVE EARLIER AND MUST STAY FOR 2 NIGHTS MORE!!!! If like we were prisoners, not the hotel guests...Instead of asking why we are leaving earlier...I donâ€™t say about the time what was lost for changing the hotels instead of enjoying the holiday... The district of the hotel is nice and quite, but the overall impression of the hotel is terrible. The manager of it definitely ought to pay more attention to the receptionists and their ways of treating the customers...More or less positive thing - breakfast and the service in the Breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel at 3* prices”
Reviews.Author: Bonbon48
Reviews.Content: I am unable to find anything negative to say about this hotel. The accommodation was comfortable,stylish and clean . The staff are helpful and friendly and have good local knowledge which they readily impart to guests. Located in a quiet location with excellent transport links to Central Amsterdam and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: richPhotog
Reviews.Content: A decent location was somewhat spoiled by tiny rooms that were cramped and had seemingly never been cleaned. The mouse spotted in the restaurant and the dead spider that remained in my shower for a good four days all added to the overall ambiance of tired shabbiness that the hotel seems to be aiming to achieve. The lack of hotel bar made it difficult to drown ones sorrows over the state of the accommodation and the snails pace of the internet connection made it impossible to write a review until I had escaped back to the relative luxury of home.

Reviews.Title: “poor treatment of guests”
Reviews.Author: rona005
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel in advance because of its location and got a reasonable deal on the price but no cancellation or change was possible. On arrival at the hotel we were advised that there was no room available and they transferred us to another hotel in another part of the city. As we were only there overnight, this took up a considerable slice of our time in Amsterdam, and we were very unhappy with the treatment we received. In hindsight, it would have been better to pay a bit more for a more reliable outfit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Vikki1984
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel 3 hours before check in and staff were nice enough to let us get in early. The room although small was nicely decorated, had a wardrobe for storage and had tea and coffee making facilities. The bed was extremely comfortable despite being 2 singles but perfect after a long day of sightseeing. The bathroom although compact was adequate for our needs. We did not speak to staff much but whenever we did they were helpful and polite. The hotel was in a great location directly across from Artis Zoo and had great transport links to city centre although the centre is within walking distance. Did not have the breakfast at the hotel as i thought it was a bit pricey but there is a nice coffee shop next door where you can pick up coffee and breakfast for about 5 Euro. Great hotel, great location, would definately consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mihail75
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel, it was good located (access to the city centre and railway station by tram 9 or 14), in a few minutes you are right in the middle of downtown. The area was not crowded, which we liked. Pluses: good location, good access, quiet area (ask for a room with the view to the park). Take the superior room (which are nice and clean, the rug was kind of old), it has more space than the standard one (which are basic). Even if the breakfast was expensive their is the option of taking a coffee or a sandwich in coffee shops close by. Minuses: the hotel owners should put something to silence the doors (an amortisor), because the doors always make noise, which is annoying especially at night and even in the morning. Someone should tell the cleaning lady not to push the doors so hard. Nice place, I will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: np74
