Reviews.Content: I popped over to Amsterdam for a long wkend recently and chose this hotel as it was relatively close to Dam central and also reasonably priced. Upon arrival, it was as I expected; A nice enough place with friendly staff. The room was ok but bathroom was extremely cramped. I am not usually in the practice of checking beds for bugs as it has been a very long time since I have stayed at a hotel where this was even necessary! So i did not... Big mistake. 2 hrs into my sleep I woke up to use the loo and after switching the light on I noticed a fair few bugs crawling on the sheets. My room was immediately changed but the damage had been done. After some negotiation, i had a mere â‚¬100 knocked off the bill. I assure you this would have been far higher if the bites I was due to notice had surfaced already. Coming back to London, I found areas of my arms and legs totally covered in bites. All in all, I would say this is a very average hotel. For the money I would expect better amenities and certainly clean sheets! Would i recommend it? Absolutely not. Fortunately, the good aspects of my trip far outweigh the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are so small you can barely swing a rat let alone a cat in this place :)”
Reviews.Author: Coolatree
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam with work and due to work always stayed in luxury hotels boy did I realize on this trip I had been spoilt up to now...On this occasion 10 of us came to party hard and to chill with a bit of luxury....some from Australia, NZ and Ireland. Due to different budgets we settled on a compromise 3 star. The hotel is located about 5 minutes from the city centre beside the zoo on tramline number 9. The rooms are so small there is no room for your suit case. I felt like I would have more in a prison cell...so if your an ex con you may get deja vu if you stay here :) Not a hotel for families or someone use to their comforts. The bathroom is so small and basic....everything is on top of each other....I had to go out all the time as I hated spending time in my room as I felt claustrophobic!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: BigNewPrinz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the few in Amsterdam which seemed to offer a level of comfort and affordability suitable for our needs as a family. On the positive side, the room was big enough for us (although the making up of the sofa bed) made negotiating getting into the room tricky) and comfortable enough. The location was quiet and rooms were suitably sound-proofed from outside noise. Check-in and check-out was relatively quick and efficient. On the negative side, the bathroom seemed a little basic for a purported 3* hotel. As others have said, the carpet and fittings were also in need of a bit of attention. The hotel seemed to have recently been owned by Best Western. My take on this was that BW recognised that the hotel was in need of renovation and so sold it on rather than make the investment. Eden seem to be trying to milk the cow with a minimum of investment - and it's starting to show. Our main issue with the hotel was the interior noise. We were positioned at the foot of the stairs which ring out with the clunk of heels at all hours (this being a lively 24 hour city). The stairs seemed particularly steep and I did wonder if elderly people could negotiate them easily - which did give me some concern in the event of a fire. I believe that they had been constructed in a way to minimise space. In any case, we did not sleep well during our visit which did inhibit our enjoyment of the city a little.

Reviews.Title: “ITS A MATTER WHAT YOU R LOOKING FOR..!”
Reviews.Author: MARKETOS21
Reviews.Content: we have visiied amsterdam in 02/02/2010 and booked in eden kancester hotel via hotels.nl We were lookinf for a hotel close by city center,clean,warm and with hot water forshower all day longAND I THINK THAT ONE WAS IDEAL..good vallue of money and service...small rooms but not a big deal.confortable beds and central heating! IN 2 MINS WALKING DISTANCE is the tram stop and in 5 mins we were in down town! IN NOVEMBER I am planning to visit Amsterdam for one more time and i have already booked in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good home away from home”
Reviews.Author: NightWorld
Reviews.Content: Not exactly the most luxurious of hotels, but everything you want, feels homely enough. Great location opposit the zoo and pretty quiet at night. The rates are good for what you get and the room big enough for what I needed. The only downside was the occasional person smoking weed outside the entrance, since my room was ground floor right next to it. Then again, that wasnt that bad and not too often. Very quiet area, felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: BirgerVE
Reviews.Content: Hi all, My partner and I went on citytrip to Amsterdam, booking the lovely Eden Lancaster Hotel with the package 'Cultuur Arrangement Standaard (2 nights)'. First of all: Amsterdam is a great place to go on a holiday, very clean city with lots of places to visit. Now for the hotel: before the trip I already had a few questions about the arrangment and some practical stuff. I received very detailed and clear information in no time, making it very easy to plan everything. Also during our stay in the hotel, the staff was very friendly and helpfull, giving various tips to make the best of our citytrip! The location of the hotel is just across the Artis zoo, what makes the hotel very accessible by public transport. When you go out of the hotel you have 2 tram stations in an area of 100m, with a straight line to the touristic places in Amsterdam (Waterlooplein, Damplein, Rembrandtplein,...). It's about 5minutes travel by tram, 20minutes walk to the very center of Amsterdam. In the arrangement there was a 48h free public transport for my girlfriend and I included, so we could use it without any further cost, very handy! The hotel is nice and clean, just as the rooms. Every day they come by for making up bed, new towels and so, no complaints about that. The breakfast was also included and was nice and tasty with 4 or 5 staff people cleaning everything up. The hotel is in the quiet part of Amsterdam, just next to a small but beautiful park. There are several tea-rooms, coffee-houses and restaurants near the hotel. One negative point: the size of the bathroom. Very small (but very clean though!), but that's the consideration you have to make I guess. It's close to the center, so the rooms are smaller than a hotel outside the center. If we would go to Amsterdam again, I'm sure we'll book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Give this place a miss”
Reviews.Author: keenest
Reviews.Content: So surprising to see the positive reviews of this hotel. Our experience exactly the opposite. Pro: - location is lovely. Walking distance to city centre and very quiet street. - good coffee shop with excellent breakfast just a few steps away. (Don't eat the overpriced hotel breakfast!) Cons: - floor of room was very dirty - overpriced hotel (poor value) - bed had hard sharp protrudence coming out of mattress - room was so small it was almost impossibile for the two of us to bring our luggage in. We had 1 only bag each!! - miniscule bathroom - overpriced breakfast at 15 Euro each. Instead, eat breakfast at the coffee shop about 3 doors down. Very disappointing hotel. Would not stay here again. A

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Tag_Beak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for the money we paid. Tram 9 & 14 stop just up the road. 9 goes direct to Centraal station via the city centre and 14 goes to city centre and Anne Franks. You can walk to Dam Square in a leisurely 30 mins. Rooms are small but ideal if you just want a bed and a location close to the centre. Area around the hotel feels very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and great sized room”
Reviews.Author: the-baconator
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 4 nights at the Eden Lancaster hotel at the end of June. Although we were slightly disappointed to find that our room was in the basement it was of a really good size and very clean so no real complaints there. The bathroom was clean and big enough and the shower was really nice and hot. We did find the toilet a bit odd, unless you shut the seat down before flushing then you'd end up with water (and whatever else) all over the floor!! We were impressed with the lovely thick blackout curtains which meant we were able to sleep any time that we wanted to. The only bad thing about this hotel was the noise!! Every night we were woken up numerous times, mainly by the sounds of people using/flushing the toilets! We could also hear any sort of conversations going on in the corridoors and the rooms next to us which did get a bit annoying. We didn't try the breakfast as we thought that 14euros each was a bit steep but 'Coffee to Walk' next door had some lovely things and there were a few bakeries too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TraceyMania
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very easy to find (thanks to my fellow trip advisors) . we got the no 9 tram from amsterdam central and got off at the zoo. its based in the nicer residental part of amsterdm, more than the downtown area. we was very early and was not able to check in till 3pm, so we have to store our luggage in the store room. when we did finanlly check iin our room was small, but we loved it, nice decor, lovely soft beds, yes the bath room is tiny, but your not there to live in it, so you dont care. we stayed in the basement room, which had bars on the windows so if there was a fire we would have been screwed. but on a whole i really like the room and the staff where nice. i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,excellent,excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Maisysmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with friends in May. The location of the hotel was excellent,away from the hustle of the centre. It was a 30 minute walk to the main areas of Amsterdam with plenty of bars on the way and a lovely way to walk with the canals all around. The local tram stopped outside of the hotel ,but as there was 6 of us we found it cheaper to get a mini bus (we found public transport expensive). Yes the bedrooms are small ,but hey you only sleep in the room and the rooms are very very clean. We did not eat in the hotel but had breakfast at the little coffee shop next door. We also ate at a bar............. not sure of name ............go out of hotel ,turn left walk to traffic light,cross over road ,the bar is across road (has table and chairs outside excellent food. For us the best way to get around was buying a day ticket for the canal boat about 20 euros ,then you can hop on and off. On the whole had a good time but thought that amsterdam was ever so expensive. I would use this hotel again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, very clean”
Reviews.Author: girlsroadtrippers
Reviews.Content: thanks, 3 girls (sorry ladies!) on first visit to amsterdam, had a great weekend, lovely clean hotel, nice comfy beds with decent bed linen in quiet location but conveniently placed for trams into centre,. Did not have breakfast here but coffee shop and bakery 200yds away. Italian restaurant around corner less than 3 mins walk very helpful staff gave us a meal despite our very late arrival from UK (after 2300hrs), also chinese restuarant less than 300yds away did not eat here but looked very nice.. All in all would most definately use this hotel again. Dont take red tourist bus, you get taken to diamond factory (not told about this) and spend 45 long minutes there, better bet would be canal boat trip or hopon/off city bus.(girls road trippers)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in stunning location!”
Reviews.Author: KingswinfordSteph
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Eden Lancaster whilst stranded in Amsterdam during the Volcano disruptions!!! The hotel is beautifully located...next to the zoo and the Botanical Gardens in Amsterdam's Garden District. Staff were very helpful in assising us to get home and the rooms were bright and comfortable. Will use this hotel when I next visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped rooms, noisy stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicola123Somerset
Reviews.Content: As part of our trip to Amsterdam, we stayed at two different hotels - the Fashion hotel and this one. Couldn't be more different! The Eden Lancaster hotel had staff who were quite rude - no warmth at all, and didn't really help when asking questions (i.e. if could check in slightly early, when room would be ready, or if we could put bags in luggage room). When we did check into our room, we were in for quite a suprise when opening the door. The smallest room I have ever been in. The door practically hits the desk when opening, and you can't sit on the chair at the desk. There was no where to put our suitcases, and everytime moved around the room, had to move the suitcases! The worst was the bathroom - your feet practically sit in the shower! The room was opposite the zoo, and is in a good location. You can walk into town and there is a tram 4 minutes walk away. Coffee shop and bakery close by - not cheap comparative to bakeries in town but good coffee Nice deli also near by. At nighttime room was very noisy - trams just below passing by. Fine for a place to sleep, not good if having a romantic weekend! Nic

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, room was a bit small but spotlessly clean, staff friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Anonnana
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to find from Central Station. The directions were emailed to me by the hotel. The room was small but very clean. The staff were all friendly enough. It is an ideal base for sightseeing. Would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindysallysmokerdoll
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel. Rooms are tiny but well equiped. Perfect for weekend break. Tram 2 minutes walk and 4/5 stops away from Rembrandt Plains. Ideal for young travellers. Staff nice also. Basic but good value for money. We didn't eat here so unsure what food is like.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in quiet location with easy access to central areas”
Reviews.Author: steph_j_d
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent value (we paid Â£43 per night for the room) and was tidy, clean and comfortable. We stayed in room 116 which was on the same floor as the reception, the room had two single beds pushed together which occassionally moved apart a bit but for a few nights it wasn't a problem. There was a LCD tv on the wall with quite a few english speaking channels, including BBC 1, a wardrobe with hanger, tea/coffee making facilities and a desk. The bathroom was rather small, in particular the toilet which wouldn't leave much room for someone with long legs sitting on it. The hotel is opposite Artis zoo, our room was to the side of the hotel and looked onto a park area, it was very quiet and night and only a little noise was heard from the other hotel rooms. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel so can't comment on it. They take â‚¬50 cash as a deposit when you check in, we had pretty much a full day on the last day so this didn't pose too much of a problem to spend it on the last day. There is a vending machine in the reception area for tea, coffee and also one for cold drinks and crisps. Alongside several tables and chairs there is a PC with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “FAB!”
Reviews.Author: jeans4330
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eden Lancaster Hotel for 3 nights. Had a very warm welcome from the receptionists. We had booked 3 rooms and they went to alot of trouble getting the rooms next to each other. The rooms were small, but nicely decorated and had a very comfortable bed. Our rooms faced the zoo, and from one of the room we could see llamas which was very exciting. We did a lot of sightseeing while we were in Amsterdam, the receptionists were very helpful, telling us exactly which trams to catch and how long it would take us to get there. This was great because it meant we didint have to wait in line a tourist information in the centre. The hotel was in a nice quiet locations, but only took a few minutes to walk into the central touristy bit. The cafe next door "Coffee to Walk" was brilliant, such good value for money and the people were really nice in there too. Overall we had a fabulous stay, cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Shari
Reviews.Content: The room was small but ok. The location was ok. We spent most of our time in central AMS so we were going back and forth a lot but the tram was a cinch and certainly didn't take away from the trip. We would probably not stay here again and try to find something closer to the city center next time BUT the plus side is this area is VERY quiet compared to the rest of AMS and noise was not an issue. We were on the main floor with a window that opened up on to an alley and loud traffic was never an issue. I give the location a five for quiet and a 3 for proximity to central ams. If we were unable to find something in our price range closer to central AMS, yeah, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel - did what it said on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Madtabby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 days in January with husband and mother in law. Booked double and single - both rooms turned out to be same size. Was worried before we arrived as had read some bad reviews however hotel was ok. Stayed on top floor and it was very quiet. Room was small but warm, bed comfortable (2 single beds zipped together). Bathroom was very small (basin, toilet and good shower) but adequate. Only downside of this hotel was the fact there was no comfy lounge area to relax in when returning to hotel after a long day spent wandering around Amsterdam. The walk into the centre of Amsterdam takes approximately 20 minutes however there is a tram stop outside the hotel and the number 9 or 14 take you directly into the main areas of interest in the city. Would I stay there again - probably.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Spainhols
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day stay. We had a family room on the top floor. Room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom quite small but had shower, basin and toilet along with a hairdryer. Could only hear souinds from next room in the bathroom as this is only pleace where rooms joined. Staff helpful. Luggage room to leave bags if you have late flight etc. Very easy to get to from airpost by train and tram (9 or 14). We bought 3 day tram passes and travelled easily to and from hotel every day, you just hop on and off as you want. There are plenty of tram stops and they run frequently. They were offering breakfast at reduced rate of Euro 10 instead of 15 but we didn't bother as there are plenty of cafes around to get breakfast at.

Reviews.Title: “If you like single duvets you'll love it here!”
Reviews.Author: sparkeytec
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here from Jan 01 to Jan 03 - upon arrival to the hotel it looks quite nice inside and also the downstair reception looks nice as well. Then it pretty much goes down hill from here. We stayed in room 404 and we were presented with the smallest hotel room i've stayed in. Upon booking i specifically requested a double/queen size bed. What we got were 2 twin beds pushed together, which is fine, but instead of a double duvet which would make perfect sense, we were given 2 very thin single duvets?! I've not experienced this before, so assumed a mistake was made. My girlfriend highlighted this to reception only to be told they have no double duvets, just single only. I've also emailed the Eden hotel group about this and they say that this is policy across their chain of hotels! With such a policy i don't understand of providing double beds in the first place. Even worse, upon removing the top sheet of bedding we found stains under the next layer. As it was well below 0 outside i requested blankets for the room as their thin, thin duvets were just simply not good enough. I was eventually accomodated with blankets by the reception. The ensuite bathroom is literally arms lengh. The shower is of good warmth and power but it doesn't have shower doors, instead it has a shower curtain and because the shower is so small, soon this curtain is wrapped around you which can not only be claustrophobic but also quite yucky considering how often will this shower curtain actually be cleaned if the sheets are anything to go by!! Also, because the walls are so thin, we were lucky enough to be able to hear every noise and conversation made from our neighbours. After we had checked out, we realised we had left a mobile phone behind so returned to the hotel after 30 minutes. We advised reception what had happened, and they contacted the maid staff who had already started to clean the room to check for it. After 20 minutes of waiting they finally phoned back to say it wasn't there. I asked if i could look and within 10 seconds of going into the room, the phone was on the floor right in front of me. The poor eyesite of the cleaning staff may explain how they miss out stains on sheets! Plus points of the hotel - it has free use of an internet pc in reception. The number 9&14 are just outside the door to take you into the city centre...and thats about it. Fortunately, Amsterdam is a great city so i will def will be coming back again just not to this hotel or one of Edens other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: mktlr33
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in this neighbourhood and was surprised by this hotel. Found it on the internet and I must say, I had a great stay. Staff was very welcoming, rooms were not that big (hey, what can expect in an old city) but room was clean. I do not like to stay in these busy touristic areas and there for I really liked this neighbourhood. Staff gave me great tips about tram and eating out, thanks you guys!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: Shaddup
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a nice location away from the touristy part of Amsterdam. The rooms are tiny. The first room i was given was very dirty. The sheets were stained and the bathroom smelled like stale urine. I got a very depressing feeling when i got into my room. I asked for a room change and was met with a little resistance but was eventually given a better one. This one was slightly larger and cleaner but had the same problem with the bathroom. I was uncomfortable spending the night here and couldn't wait to leave the next morning. It felt like a very seedy place to be very honest. I'm sure other guests might have had a far better experience then myself. I would rate this hotel as a 1-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better”
Reviews.Author: Julietta_D
Reviews.Content: We booked the room in this hotel with the special offer (-30%), but there wasn't mentioned that it will be the underground room. Our window was very-very small and all we could see were shoes of the people passing by. Also the manager of the hotel bloked the cost of the stay on my credit card as a pawn and inspite the fact that we payed in cash he dismissed the block only in a month after we leaved, because he just forget to do this in time. The room was not new, but cleane and warm. The hotel is in walking distance from the centre and this is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, but expensive breakfast and no free wi-fi in room”
Reviews.Author: Baibaks
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay at this hotel. Room is small, but enough to spend a night there. Clean and nice equipped. Very good location - tram no. 9. and 14. has stops 2 min walk from hotel entrance. Free wi-fi in lobby, but no free internet in room :( Breakfast - average choice, but too expensive - EUR 15,- per person. Staff at reception could be more smiling and open - girls, who worked on evenings was like she had swallowed a brick - never saw a smile on her face :(

Reviews.Title: “And goodnight to you too”
Reviews.Author: j0hnhill
Reviews.Content: What a strange hotel, walls are made from the finest Japanese house paper, toilets and bathroom resemble safe doors in the lobby to the room and the TV has as much porn as you can handle during a two night stay! Hotel is situated opposite the Zoo and about a mile from the city centre which is easily reached via the tram network from outside or you can walk in as its flatter than an Edward & John concert! We spent most of our vsit listening to our neighbours talking and drying their hair, even thugh we had snow during our visit it was warm and reasonably cheap, this was the time when I used sites other than tripadvisor to find hotels that would sleep four. If you want cheap and cheerful, bingo, if not look nearer to the centre of town, following our visit, I sent my Mom to Amsterdam for her 70th to the Tulip in Dam Square and she raved about it for, well, she hasn't stopped yet three years on! For those who think that Amsterdam is a den of eniquaty, then you couldn't be more wrong, its a cultured, interesting and beautifl den of eniquaty ad has enough to keep you busy for a few days, so much so, I also sent my son and his American fiancee there for their engaement present last year, they also loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: birmingham_girl32
Reviews.Content: This is on a couple of great tram lines (9 and 14), opposite the zoo and is actually only prob 15/20 mins (and a pleasant walk), away from the city. Nice and quiet location. Hotel itself is okay when you arrive but room is bit tatty. My room needs new carpet having seen its best. Has kettle so you can make hot drinks, didnt bother with eating breakfast there as it's expensive and there are a couple of places next door you can get something to eat. Shower is tight but is okay. I've seen worse! Bed was comfortable, heating is great - kept the room really nice and cosy. Got to watch BBC TV which was an unexpected bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and affordable centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Tresmaafisk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a luxury hotel, but considering the prices in Amsterdam in general, this is good value! On the negative side; the rooms are tiny (but just big enough to fit a travel bed in), it may be a bit noisy if someone has a party (but you can easily tell the reception if you have any issues) and the breakfast is too expensive (15Euro per person). On the positive side; the staff are helpful, the hotel is clean and safe, location is good (possible to walk to Dam Square) just opposite Artis Zoo and there are several trams stopping just outside. Some ok restaurants in the immediate area as well makes this a good place to stay. And they had coffee and tea facilities in the room :-) We stayed in the beginning of October, then went to the Hague, and decided on the same hotel when we came back to Amsterdam a few days later. If you arrive at the central station in Amsterdam, you can catch tram number 9 to Artis Zoo - and you will find the hotel there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Staff. Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick24
Reviews.Content: I've just recently returned from a three night stay in the Hotel Eden Lancaster and have already booked to go back early next year! The staff were excellent and extremely acommodating throughout the whole stay. The room was a good size, clean and with the most comfortable beds. Its in a perfect location, 2 minutes away from the tram lines which take you through the heart of Amsterdam and are also on route to the Central Station which is a 15 minutes tram ride away. On the other side of the hotel after a short walk down to Alexandraplein you are on the other tram line which leads you to the hugely popular Leidsplien Square. It was a thoroughly enjoyable stay in a brilliant city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fallenxiii
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, really friendly staff. Breakfast was standard ie nothing special. Room and bathroom were clean. Fab location, 10min tram ride from Dam Square, or 25min walk. Really nice area. Only issue was double bed was really two single beds pushed together, not ideal for a romantic weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a skort stay ..”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Kuller
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are small, but for a short stay, it is okay. The breakfast was nice, but shuld be included ... it was quite expencive (15â‚¬ p.p.) We came by car, and the parking was also very expencive (36â‚¬ a day).

Reviews.Title: “very nice helpfull”
Reviews.Author: hildadajos
Reviews.Content: our room was a little stuffy airwise, lthough we had a fan - the kids was bigger and better - the staff were very helpful all the time, they were very helpfull and respectfull in our special needs to keep the Jewish sabbath, opeing electric doors for us, finding me a place to light candles etc. position ver convenient, quiet, on two tramm lines or just 20 minute walf to center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Langlee81
Reviews.Content: After traveling through France, Belgium and the Netherlands, we rated this hotel as one of the better ones we found. The value was pretty good. I appreciated the tasteful decor and cleanliness of the rooms. It was easy enough to find after taking the tram from the train station. The staff were really courteous and answered our questions. We found that the breakfast was too pricey for us, so we went a couple of doors down the street to a cafe. The only negative thing was that the walls were a little thin. I could hear someone hacking up a storm early in the morning. I'm guessing that was their morning ritual.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Vic112
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden Lancaster for 3 nights. The hotel itself is lovely and the staff were polite and helpful. It was in a good location - 2 mins walk from the nearest tram stop (which was en route to take you right in to the centre) and in the opposite direction 2 mins from the zoo. Breakfast was not included in the total price and I did feel the hotel was a little on the expensive side but after researching other hotels in Amsterdam, the Eden seemed to be one of the better ones. In my experience, the majority of half decent hotels in Amsterdam were not cheap anyway! The room was adequate, clean and tidy with tea making facilities, flat screen TV and safe. The bathroom was small and looked like some parts of it had been updated (shower and sink) but its size is not a complaint. It was fine for a short stay and only 2 people. There were also vending machines in reception as well as a computer for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, on a quiet area, but 5 min tram from center”
Reviews.Author: booLisbon
Reviews.Content: I've been in eden lancaster 5 nights, with my husband and children (4 and 9). The room was a litle tight with 4 beds, but very confortable beds and pillows. Quiet area, near the Artis Zoo, 10 min walk to NEMO. 5 min by tram to the city center. Good place to rest after walking around all day. We skiped breakfast on the hotel (15â‚¬/p.p.) and went next door to "Coffe to walk" a very cozy CafÃ© with toast in brown bread, hot chocolat, mocaccino. Very good breakfast. The Italian restaurant around the corner, was good and inexpensive. We all loved amsterdam, good city to go with children.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok & clean”
Reviews.Author: lalalatracy
Reviews.Content: Check in is at 3pm & check out is 11am- I've never been to hotel that checks in so late & check out so early! It was quite annoying. Slow Wifi available only in lobby but have ethernet in room not sure if they charge. It's a bit of a hit & miss with this hotel re rooms, we had a party of 14ppl so we had 7 rooms on all diff floors, from basement to 3rd floor. 3 of 7 rooms were good sizes with good size bathrooms the rest were tiny with really really small bathrooms -small to the point where if you sit on the toilet your knees will touch the wall (we're only 5ft!) and if you lean over the sink to wash your face your bum will touch the door so you have to have the door open to wash your face 4 of 7 had bedroom doors that either didn't lock or had to be slammed shut 1 of 7 room was so hot & stuffy we had to move (basement) 1 of 7 room had a bathroom door that didn't shut properly I had a room on 2nd floor facing the stairs, the room was as on the website- so it was fine for me. There is hair dryer, kettle, coffee in the room but no mini fridge, there are no shampoo/cond/shower gel- they only provide you with shower caps & towels. The staff are helpful & friendly & polite & got things done quickly. Overall the hotel is clean and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mel1984NIreland
Reviews.Content: from we arrived at the hotel until we left the staff were brillant as we arrived before check in which was 3pm but our room was ready for us .. i disliked the fact we had to pay a 50 euro deposit in fear we broke something .. but in an upside we got it back again when we check out ... the room was well decorated but could have done with being bigger .. rooms were cleaned daily which was a must .. house keepers were very polite .. and the beds were very comfy ... the bathroom was very small ... breakfast wasn't great as it was included in our package ... if we had to pay for it ..it would have been 15 euro each which i don't think it was worth ..... location was quiet apart from the trams running every few minute's it was a 15 - 20 min walk into town which isn't to bad if you like walking but tram no 9 goes past the hotel over all my husband and myself were very pleased with the service we recieved during our stay .. will definetely stay again ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location to Stay”
Reviews.Author: R_and_PMD
Reviews.Content: This 3 star hotel, whilst located a short distance from the centre of Amsterdam, is in a lovely quite area next to the Artis (zoo). The number 9 Tram runs up the street outside and gives easy access to the city centre (10 mins) and Central Station (15 mins). Having walked the streets of the centre I would much rather have stayed here than right in the centre. The room was excellent (room 116), well furnished, modern and clearly recently refurbished, there were other rooms which were clearly a bit smaller but furnished to the same standard. A wide variety of hot and cold food was available at breakfast. A lovely place to stay and highly recommended. If using the Trams your ticket is valid for one hour on any line - our guide book didn't mention this.

Reviews.Title: “not sure how this Hotel got 3 stars?”
Reviews.Author: jkiddscot
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned business traveller I was disapointed by this Hotel. NEGATIVE Doors have no handles and need slammed to shut Room Carpet was stained (Why dont they clean stained carpets?) TV set half hidden by closet room not aired perfunctory staff bathrooms very 'bijou' POSITIVE quiet location bed comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid Choice for Amsterdam on a budget”
Reviews.Author: theworldsmyoyster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the beginning of March on a city break with my husband. We found the hotel to be more than adequate for our requirements and whilst not being in the centre we found this was not a problem as it was only approx 15/20 minutes walk to Dam Square. The fact that it is out of the hub-bub was an advantage in our opinion, as the area is quiet and therefore there was little external noise at night with the exception of the trams passing below occasionally. We thought the internal walls were rather thin however, as we could hear various mundane sounds from the occupants of the rooms adjacent to ours ie. coughing and the sound of the TV very clearly. Our room although small was modern and clean but we were only there to sleep, change and shower .... which brings me to the shower room/loo - I wouldn't say that you couldn't swing the proverbial cat, but only because I'm not altogether sure you and the cat could physically get in there together at the same time in the first place. So, yes it's small, but it does the job so as long as you are aware of that and don't expect a massive luxurious bath to wallow in, you'll be fine. We had little contact with the desk staff apart from check in and check out and they were efficient and polite so no complaints there. As I said in the title of this review if you require a clean, relatively comfortable bed in Amsterdam, you won't go amiss here I think. Incidentally, didn't try the breakfast as we prefer to get up and get out into the city but we thought that the glasses and ice available in reception was a nice touch especially if you brought your own drinks back - which you could purchase at a supermarket just up the road by the way.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, staff extremely helpful and pleasent”
Reviews.Author: m55w
Reviews.Content: Having spent a night at the Eden Lancaster hotel we must give a good review for the experience. We booked a superior room, which was wonderful. Roomy, immaculate, quiet and a very comfortable bed. The breakfast was well presented with plenty of choice on the buffet. The overall experience was a real bargain and we would have no hesitation in returning to the hotel again and again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Eden Lancaster - okay as a place to just sleep and eat breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rosbaby
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to Amsterdam, and we stayed at the Eden Lancaster. Our experience there was just okay, but we did have a couple of problems. Location: The hotel is a very easy tram ride from Central Station. Just hop on Tram 9 and you reach the hotel in maybe six stops. It stops one short block away from the hotel so it's very convenient. It costs 1.6 Euro per person. The hotel is a very easy walk to the huge shopping areas, the Jewish museum, the Botanical Garden, the Artis Zoo, and a few other attractions. It takes a while longer to reach Dam Square, the Red Light District, and any of the other sights. I would say it was easily a mile or so to walk to any of those--very manageable if you are a big walker. It seemed like a safe, quiet area because it was far enough away from the main attractions. Check-in/Concierge: It was fine. We arrived just before noon. The only problem was that, during our three days there, there were very very few times when people would be out at the concierge desk. It often looked deserted. They did have a large bell that needed to be rung because it seemed like most of the employees chose to stay in a room in the back for the majority of the day. When we had questions, it always seemed like we were bothering or interrupting them from being in the back room. Also, we had some questions about taxis and airport shuttles, and the employees gave us some incorrect information--which surprised me because I figured that it was something they should know. Room: It was on the small size but it was nicely decorated in modern-looking and sparse furniture. There only seemed to be room for the closet and the bed, but that is fine if you don't plan on spending too much time in the room anyway. Not too much room for luggage! The room did contain many great magazines on Amsterdam; some of them had coupons with savings for tourists, which was nice. The room was cleaned every day and kept in good condition. The bed did sink lower on the side toward the bathroom. Bathroom: The bathroom was the biggest problem for me because it was tiny. Two people could definitely not fit into it. The toilet ran every time it was flushed, and we found ourselves jiggling the flusher every time until it stopped running. In fact, it was running when we first checked into the room. I never quite got the hang of it even after three days. Also, the light stopped working on the first day we were there. We called in about it and someone came in and jiggled the light a few times before it started working again. Breakfast: It was nice that the breakfast service was available for long hours. They did a nice job, offering a good mixture of hot and cold items. They had things like pancakes, eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. Amenities: The books in the room said that free internet was available in the hotel lobby, but the computer was broken the entire time we were there so we never got to take advantage of it. The wireless available in the lobby was also very slow. Transportation: We chose to take the tram back to Central Station for 1.60 Euro and then we took the airport shuttle back to the airport for about 4.50 Euro per person. It didn't take too much time and seemed very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: AnamikaRaks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on 24 hour layover in Amsterdam. Super easy to get to hotel, train into town and one tram from central station. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful with postcard issues and arranging ride back to airport in the morning. We bought the tickets from the hotel desk and they called for the pick up. The room was a little bit of a disappointment. There is no lift to the bottom floor (daylight basement). There was a lift at the back that went part way down but then there was another half flight of stairs. The room was at the front of the hotel so we had bars on the window and a view of knees as people walked by. Being under reception we also had quite a bit of noise between the street and hotel patrons until midnight or so then it dropped off. Still noisy,but not unbearable. The bathroom was not in the best of repair. Some of the trim was falling off and the tiling was old and slightly damaged in the shower. It just didn't feel like it belonged in the same hotel. The bed was comfortable though, and the room was well designed. For one night it was OK. If we had been staying another night I would have requested a different room. That all being said, the staff was amazing. I would recommend this hotel, just not this room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel during Cool Weather”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Nice_Gentlemen
Reviews.Content: The lancaster hotel is located near the Artis zoo so it is a plus if you have kids, it is also located in the center of Amsterdam only three tram stops away from Rembrandtplien where you can find restaurants, shops and cinemas. The tram costs 1.6 euros and it is valid for one hour only. From the central station I took a taxi to the hotel which costs 20 euros. I took a standard double room booked from the hotel website, the room is good for only two persons, if you have kids then you need a bigger room, there is almost enough space to walk to the other side of the bed. The room has a toilet next to a sink next to a shower all inclined in one row â€œcompact designâ€� which will be perfect if you are in an airplane not a hotel. There is no shower gel so you have to bring your own, they provide with the room a small soap near the sink to wash your hands and excellent two pairs of towels for the face and body. The shower is perfect however you should be careful the HOT water is extremely hot so if you have kids they have to be supervised when using the shower or the sink. The room is clean and comfortable you can have a good night sleep here without interruptions or noise since the area is quite at night. There is a small safe in the room located in the closest which is enough for valuables to keep. If you have kids then be careful when leaving them alone at night watching the TV â€œlocal channelsâ€� is not PG anymore even the free channels are not for kids, maybe possible to lock these channels at the reception desk. There is no mini bar so you canâ€™t cool your water or other beverages you have. However, there is a vending machine in the lobby that offers cool water and other beverages. In addition, there is a nearby cafÃ© which I use to get breakfast also dinner named â€œcafÃ© kroosjeâ€�. For dry cleaning and washing your clothes, I used the clean center near the Heineken factory they charge per kilo for washing and for ironing they charge extra however they are very cheap compared to the hotel rates for dry cleaning. To reach the clean center take tram 10 after you walk south from the hotel leave the zoo to your left and walk until you find the tram 10 stop and then take tram 10 and stop at weteringschans then walk south until you reach the Heineken building and then you find the clean center on the Fredbolstr. Street. Finally, the windows should be left open to have air refreshes the room and during night you have to leave the windows open since it gets hot in the room without AC but be careful to switch any lights so to avoid mosquito entering your room. I will definitely stay at this hotel again only during winter times or cool weather, I will not stay here in the summer since there is no AC in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good value”
Reviews.Author: wesley66
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel and overall, was pretty satisfied. Yes, the rooms and the bathrooms are a little tight on space but everything was very clean is decorated to a good standard. It takes about 10 - 15 minutes to walk to Dam Square but it is a pleasant walk with lots to look at on the way. If you can get a discount or special rate, this hotel is definitely recommended. Very nice staff too. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Perfect.....”
Reviews.Author: ruthjane01
Reviews.Content: Right next to the zoo.... easy with the trams....easy to walk into the main parts.....breakfast was delicious!!!! staff were helpfull...rooms were quite small.....well worth going back!!! Ruth + Andy

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel BUT”
Reviews.Author: Molly050
Reviews.Content: Eden Lancaster Amsterdam .My husband and i stayed at this hotel and we thought the hotel was lovely and staff great .But we couldnt believe it that we got bitten alive by FLEAS in the bed.Imin agony since i got home as they have got very infected and really disapointed .Has anybody else had this experience????

Reviews.Title: “located near the Zoo”
Reviews.Author: scouser79
Reviews.Content: A very small hotel in a good location close to the zoo. The bathroom was very very compact and would not suit a large person. The shower was good however. Rooms equipped with tea and coffee making facitlies although they did not clean the cups or replace them but you could get more from the reception area. This hotel was right next to the zoo which was a fantastic zoo and within wlaking distance of the Rambrandt square. It was on a tram line number 9 and 12 but the walk into the centre was very pleasant. Breakfast in the hotel was expensive 15 Euro each compared to the choice you had quite locally so would recommend you ate out. The zoo nearby is well worth a visit - reduction of 4 Euros after 3.30pm - 17.50 normally but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, quiet location, small room”
Reviews.Author: ultravox
Reviews.Content: I'm a solo traveler who stayed at the Eden Lancaster in January. The hotel is located near the Artis Zoo on a moderately quiet street. My room faced the street and the first thing I noticed was the trams that pass the hotel all day. Luckily, the windows are thick and cut out a lot of the noise. The room that I was in was very small and had barely enough room to store my luggage. The bathroom was as small as it could be, maybe 6 ft by 3 feet, but spotlessly clean. There is a safe in the room and a television mounted to the wall. The room lighting was good and for Amsterdam it was well ventilated and seemed to be well insulated. Also, there is a convenient elevator for use. The breakfast was probably the highlight of my hotel stay. It was very good and had about everything you could imagine, from yoghurt and fruit, to a variety of rolls and bread, to cold cuts and cheeses and cereals. There is a nice coffee/espresso machine as well as a juice dispenser which also included a strange orange colored "vitamin" drink which doesn't do much for a hangover. Speaking of that, beer in a Dutch restaurant runs e4.50 for a pint sized choice so a nice option is to walk to Waterlooplein, about 10 minutes away, where you'll find a large supermarket (Albert Heijn). The supermarket has a wide variety of beer for a fraction of what you would pay in a restaurant. This is the lead in for the low point of my hotel stay. I went out for the day and left 3 beers in a bag. When I came back to the room, the bag was gone and one beer was left on the dresser. Point of that is, if you have anything of value and you can fit it in the hotel safe, don't hesitate to do so. Now that I ripped the house keepers, I do want to say that they changed the towels and made the bed every day during my 5 day stay so I thought of the missing beers as a sort of tip. On to reception. The check -n was great. The room was ready when I arrived at 10:30 a.m. The nightstaff at reception were aloof, on the other hand, but I didn't have to deal with them that much. The hotel is quite far from most of the action. If you are a walker, like me, then the only thing you have to worry about is the elements. January is actually a good time to go to Amsterdam but it certainly does rain. One good thing about the hotel's location is the nearby restaurants. Like a previous poster, I also recommend Pasta Villa, located one block toward Waterlooplein. It has good, reasonably priced Italian food. Another good thing about the location is that there are plenty of small convenience stores near the hotel. The area is quiet and has a safe feeling. I saw parents with children out and about, something that you eerily don't see much of in most other parts of the city. Other than the zoo, another unique, closeby and must see attraction to visit is the Flea Market at Waterlooplein on Sundays. The hotel is a bit of a hike from Centraal Station. It took me about 30 minutes but if you aren't into walking there is a tram stop less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel. All in all, I would stay at this hotel again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great for walkers”
Reviews.Author: dragondivawales
Reviews.Content: Attractive,clean hotel;lovely staff;very good buffet breakfast served until 10.30;small rooms but with everything you could need;10-15 mins walk from Dam square but trams run outside hotel front door;nice neighbourhood opposite zoo and close to several cafes and restaurants (recommend 'Happy Corner' chinese for tasty reasonably priced food and 'Pasta Villa' for great buzzy Italian with lovely food(and cheap !)We like to walk and found it a great way to see the city and the hotel being in the suburbs was not a problem for us.Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: craignmick
Reviews.Content: We came back from Amsterdam last weekend, we stayed from 25-27th August. We arrived in Amsterdam very early on Saturday morning and arrived at the hotel at 9.50 and asked to leave our luggage as the ckeck-in was not for a few hours, to our delight they allowed us into our room there and then! The room was 004 and on the basement level it was clean, comfortable and had Sky T.V and a good shower. There are two types of people who shoud not go to this hotel, groups of lads wanting to be right in the action (as dam square is 10 minute walk) and people wanting 5 star standards. In conclusion for the price the hotel has great service, is clean and in a nice area. P.S If your looking for a nice Italian Maria's in the South of the city is great and half the price of Italians in the red light area.

Reviews.Title: “safe,great staff, decent value for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: globalistDc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the Plantage area, which is nice & green & quiet compared to downtown Amsterdam. The staff are super: very nice & eager to make your stay pleasant. The room was fine though small, & had a nice flat screen TV. Walls are THIN and lots of guests are in Amsterdam to party, so I did not get much sleep. What other people wrote the plumbing I found to be true also: the toilet ran ENDLESSLY unless I shut off the water, & the shower spilled all over the bathroom floor. But truth be told: I was there for a conference, and comparing notes with other people whose hotels were in the same price range, I felt REALLY LUCKY. The fact of the matter seems to be, unless you want to pay $300+/night, your choice of accommodations in Amsterdam is quite a mixed bag -- and the Eden Lancaster is not at all a bad bet.

Reviews.Title: “No Real problems”
Reviews.Author: dooowahdooowah
Reviews.Content: After reading the very mixed reviews of this hotel - some saying it is fine - others saying it is awful - i was a little apprehensive as to wether it would ruin or stay. Well it really does depend on you expectations. if you were expecting a very grand, large spacious room with lots of facilities then this is not for you. It is basic and clean. the room is small and a double is 2 beds pushed together. the bathroom is a bit small too and there are no tea and coffe making facilites. This did not make a difference to us as we only used it to sleep in and wash. it was fine as a place to stay if you will be doing a lot of sightseeing and are about town all day - but if you like your creature comforts and little homely touches - then this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: corrina_china
Reviews.Content: There are no redeeming characteristics of this hotel. The location, while not a bad neighborhood, is out of the charming canals. The lobby and the rooms reek of smoke. I was first given an uninhabitable room with two beds shoved in a space that could barely have had one. The shower did not work. After complaining twice, they gave me a room where the shower actually had water but the drain didn't work and the shower curtain wound around my body. To top it off, breakfast was not included and there was only internet access in the smoke filled lobby. I found another hotel and checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel at great city rates”
Reviews.Author: TC299
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Schipol Airport and took a train to Centraal Station. Easy to get to. We then took a taxi to the Hotel, it was 13 euro. The Hotel is located to the south side of the zoo, about a 20 - 30 minute walk to the centre of the city. Nice to dander into town on a dry evening. However, we bought 3 day tram passes at reception, 13 euro each, so we could hop on and off as we pleased. This suited us fine, as we returned to the hotel at teatime before going out for the night. A taxi back to the hotel after 11pm cost us less than 10 euro on each occasion we used one. We arrived at check-in time, to be advised that our rooms were not quite ready. We were dealt with politely and were able to check-in after a 15 minute wait. The bedrooms are small, about 3m x 3m, and the ensuite is tiny - about 1m x 2m. So previous reviews are accurtate in that respect. I'm on the large side myself, 6'2" and I had no issue accessing or using the facilities - just know to expect this. The bedroom facilities, as with any Best Western, are pretty good, including free room safe, multi channel tv, phone and internet (though we did not use this). The bathroom did not have a facecloth. Besides being well equipped, our rooms had views over a small park, and were clean apart from some minor marks on the carpet. We did not have breakfast as we were never up in time and it was 14 euro extra. Plenty of dining options around and about, typically less than 10 euro for a full cooked breakfast. We took evening meals in and around Amsterdam, and found it to be priced a little on the higher side than at home in Northern Ireland, so as a city break destination I suppose it compared fairly favourably. There is no bar facility in the Hotel, so drinks were purchased from a vending machine when we returned in the evenings and fancied a night cap. The staff were helpful and well presented. Amsterdam itself is a pretty city with a very continental, cosmopolitan feel. Lots and lots of canals, more than you might imagine, look out for the cyclists and listen for their bells - get out of their way because they will not stop if you are walking in a cycle lane. Check out the shops around "9 streets", and the open minded should take an early evening walk around the RLD - just to see what goes on. It really is mad. Be careful though; plan your way and look after your belongings as there are some undesireables hanging around. We had a great break, even though we stayed three nights we could have used another couple, so we will return another time. I would have no problem staying at BW Lancaster House again as it offered good value for decent, if cramped facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A little basic but all you need”
Reviews.Author: TheCollies
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my partner and 2 friends. We arrived quite late on a Friday night and walked from Central Station. It is quite a distance but we did not feel unsafe at any point in the neighbourhood. The hotel is to the East of the city centre but we did not find it a problem walking the 20mins into the centre. There are some very nice bars and restaurants across from the zoo which are well worth a visit. The only down side was that whilst our rooms were on different sides of the hotels we were put in the basement so it was not possible to open the windowds to cool the room down and you could hear the trams so a good pair of ear plugs would be advisable if you are a light sleeper. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room generally ok though you could both sit on the toilet and have a shower at the same time as the bathroom is so small. The hotel is perfect for those on a buget but not really for anyone who is after any pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this dive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the worst we ever stayed in. Even though the rooms are small and dismal with old stained mattresses and dirty sheets, they still charge as much as a 3 or 4 star hotel. The breakfast was an extra 14 Euros per person and not worth it. This hotel is definitely the worst Best Western we have seen. It doesn't even deserve a Best Wester title.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband booked a room via Opodo - we only stayed for one night but it was enough! We went to this hotel as we thought Best Western meant quality. well, we were wrong. The room is tiny, the wallpaper dirty, the carpet worn. But most of all, the bathroom is incredibly small, there is no actual shower - only a curtain, and sitting on the toilet leaves only 2 choices: either hitting your head on the door or on the sink. The heating was not working in our room and we were simply offered more blankets, no apologies, no nothing!!! DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Truth about Best Western Lancaster”
Reviews.Author: mdarn24
Reviews.Content: The Truth about Best Western Lancaster Hotel. This is NOT a nice hotel. We paid $135.00(USD)for this hotel and expected alot more. DON'T BE FOOLED, BREAKFAST IS NOT COMPLIMENTARY! First of all, it is not close to the main attractions of Amsterdam at all. At least a 20-30 minute tram ride each time. Second, the hotel is not very nice. Our room was in the basement and was very poorly designed. The bathroom flooded into the bedroom everytime you took a shower. There was no control over the tempature, so the room was very cold. When you check in they tell you all about the wonderful breakfast they serve the next morning and make no mention of a price. When you go to the breakfast there is no mention of price. When you check out however, they charge to your credit card all visits to thr breakfast buffet 14 $euro per breakfast. So ... Go get a dutch waffle, way cheaper and they taste better. The lobby area is a joke and the internet they provide you at the hotel is $5 euro for a half hour. Do, find yourself an internet cafe where you can spend $1.50 euro for a half hour. My advice don't stay here unless you get a really great deal, like $60 dollars a night for a double room (2 twin beds pushed together).

Reviews.Title: “Credit card theft”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked in here for one night in February 2006. They swiped my Amex and I went to bed - room probably the smallest I've ever slept in but very clean and nicely laid out. Next morning checked out, with no extras to pay for and went to my meeting then flew home. When I get my Amex statement I see that I am supposed to have made two telephone calls totalling eight minutes and costing Â£50 odd pounds! The calls were made in California apparently and charged to my card. Reported to Amex who are investigating but if no luck with them it's off to the Dutch police.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: omaghguy
Reviews.Content: The title of this review says it all. a great hotel. My partner and i arrived in this hotel at 3pm, we were greated by a friendly man at reception who spoke great english and he booked us in in a matter of minutes and we made our way to the lift. The rooms where not very big but very very clean and warm even with the radiator off and the cold dutch weather outside!! The hotel seems to have been recently refubished and its very new but still retaining some of its old charm. Beds are the most comfortable i have ever slept in. It not right in the city centre but thats good as amsterdam can be quite noisy so dont worry you will have a great nights sleep in this hotel. From amsterdam central station u can buy a 1,2,or 3 day pass which will get you unlimuted transport on trams buses and subway all round the city and there is a tram stop almost on the door step of this hotel so its so easy to get about as they come along every 15mins or so. There is a lack of a bar in the hotel which might put some people off but hey there is no shortage of bars in amsterdam so why would ya wana stay in your hotel when you could be out exploring! There is also a very good chinese resturant just round the corner which is very cheap. ok well all i can say is please if your visiting amsterdam then this is the hotel to stay in, il definatly be back in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Snixy
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel's situation - the area is very quiet and peaceful, yet only 10 to 15 minutes' walk from the city centre, or about 5 minutes on a tram - which are great for getting about on, and there's a stop just down the road from the hotel on a route that goes direct to Centraal Station. We stayed for 3 nights, and although our room was quite small, it had everything you need - the bed was wonderfully comfy, the shower was efficient and the water was hot. What we liked best was that it was quiet, so you could get a decent nights' sleep - what more could you ask? The staff were very pleasant and helpful, and the breakfast, although continental style, does include cereal, fruit, toast etc, so there's always something to eat. Our only criticism is that there is no evening meal available. We did a lot of walking in Amsterdam, and it would have been nice to have the option to eat at the hotel. Having said that, there are at least 3 eating places literally moments away, if you can't face the journey into town, so it's not a major issue. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “some problems”
Reviews.Author: alebar
Reviews.Content: i was in amsterdam in 17/19 august and i have booked at lancaster the package with 2night 120euro in a single room and 2 night 140euro in double...the price is very good,location not bad,then they give me breackfast included in price...but i have asked for quiet rooms and i had a room very noisy on street,my room was very poor and little,not more then 6metres,incredible!i have parked my car in street for 30,60euro daily,so you can understand that amsterdam is not cheap....the hotel was cheap but not good choice for me,may be they have rooms much better and sell the little and poor rooms with special offers.this hotel is a choice if you want pay little,not if you want a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. It is very clean, the rooms are nice and the staff are very friendly. It is a little bit out of the centre, but the trams are fantastic. Catch a 9 or 14 into the centre (they come along every 5 mins or so).

HotelInfo.Name: Hampshire Hotel - Lancaster Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Plantage Middenlaan 48, Amsterdam NL-1018 DH, The Netherlands
